r-IrtkISfOUAlcizxpTQmA.text: Soooo I was super excited to try this new place. Fb has been popping with the news of Walter's. So I gather a group of family for our 1st monthly ladies dine out and we head over. So at first you walk in and you're like ok you can smell the bbq. We sat ordered apps. (Had to pull out flashlight on phone because the lighting is none) Enjoyed those. Ordered our dinner and again we are laughing excited. Then bam 2 couples come in both with dogs. Now I have no problem with service dogs. But these were not those. They proceeded to go to bar and they actually picked the one dog up and had it on the bar stool with its ASS on the bar. The bartender came over and PET the dog. Well that's it. Ohh yea it was raining all day outside. So now the beautiful bbq smell is taken over by the smell of wet dog and now the unsanitary condition of the dog on stool other dog trying to eat the scraps off the floor was way to much. Now I understand people love their dogs but that doesn't mean I love your dog. Or should I be in a RESTAURANT and a dog is just allowed to roll up in there. My whole experience was ruined and the rest of the table felt the same. I will not be back, and I will not recommend. Oh yea and after the dogs left no one wiped or mopped where the dogs were. So now I'm thinking are the lights dim because there is dog hair all over the place? Leave the damn dogs at home. #sorrynotsorry

RgKJWlpPFyjx_4duf2Vp_A.text: I hate giving negative reviews but i thought i should post some things here not to deter people from going but so management can try to fix things as this place moves forward  The whole setup is sort of confusing and the staff wasn't very helpful. We weren't sure if we had to wait for a table (which 2 staff members told us we had to do) or could we just grab a spot (which eventually we did)  The servers were very nice but admitted to being overwhelmed. I guess their WiFi on their iPads did not reach outside so they would take multiple orders on paper then go in to put them into the iPad. This caused a lot of confusion. Multiple times food and drinks were brought to our table that weren't ours. Which was equally frustrating cause our food and drink (i ordered 1 drink) took 45 minutes to come.    I liked the food but because it took so long it was cold. I think the bbq meats prob are done already and need to be heated but if you order something like the fried chicken you have to wait for it. The timing was off for sure. But the food tasted really good, i got brisket wings ribs and a baked potato. My daughter loved the Mac and cheese.  I think other people were having similar issues as well. People started to go to the bar to order drinks and food then just taking them out themselves which was the smart thing to do but then the bar staff was way overwhelmed. There's also no official drink menu only a draft list at this time.  I think these are all growing pains of a new place and i really hope these things can be fixed so they can succeed the outdoor space is awesome and the food has great potential.. however with so many new bbq places popping up in the city they're going to have to iron out the kinks to make it.

ZtRj8jyoio-_YeU2ZdM1mQ.text: Great food! Great bourbon. Had chicken sandwhich and fatty brisket! Great new addition to the PGH restaurant scene. Owners came out to visit to make sure everything was good.

e_V7ya6bKX3WT22rAQO0Ow.text: It's a decent location and I've been watching the place under construction for a while. A friend and I were biking by and locked up to the bike rack to check it out and have a drink. The beers were really expensive...$8/each for local beer. I had a beer labeled as an "American IPA" and it was definitely a hazy IPA...so whoever wrote the draft list on the chalkboard doesn't know their beers. I was also really confused at the "American" flag on the wall. With all this hooplah lately about the flag and what it stands for or whatever, I would think that an American-esque bbq place would have an actual American flag if they wanted a flag up, not some weird flag with too many stars that wants to be the American flag but obviously isn't...just kind of an insult. I'm as liberal as it comes, but this just doesn't seem right at this spot in particular. It doesn't fit in or make sense. Also, I've never seen a bartender request people that had just sat down move seats. I get wanting to keep two seats together in case 2 people come and want to sit together, but the bartender actually asked people that had just sat down to move over...the bar wasn't full and this was a super weird thing to do. Staying there for just 1 drink was long enough for me.

7CgZZe6YsQAcIjj3pNqFqw.text: Food was amazing! Bacon appetizer was delicious!! Our group of five had the half chicken, briskets, fried chicken sandwich and the Jamaican Mac & cheese. No complaints! Service was good. We sat outside in their heated tent. Rainy cold day but we were very comfortable. Definitely will be back & recommend!!

SUZRCBZIyj8jhfH7-fMazA.text: So I was SUPER excited to try this place as a friend recommended it, it's right down the street and smells awesome. The atmosphere was strange, maybe because it was lunch time? It was oddly quiet aside from traffic TVs were on but no sound, music blasting in the restroom but nowhere else, just strange. No employees around, except a bartender and one very disgruntled server. I don't think polite, let alone nice was ingrained in her personality. The bartender eventually appeared and she was nice enough but she took our orders and never came back. The scowling server literally dropped our food off didn't ask if we needed anything else (sauce for our food, or a refill on both empty drinks on our table). I eventually went up to the bar for refills and some sauce. When we finally stood up with our purses and started looking around as no service was around at this point Miss Meanmug appears with a little credit card machine and hands it to my godmother whose 77 years old, neither of us had much clue what to do with it. She didn't say anything to us just left it and walked away. We wanted to take the portion we didn't finish but clearly we weren't allowed to speak with anybody about getting a lid as they serve your food in paper. As we're attempting to figure out this credit card do dad, (which I guess she assumed we were paying with thankfully we were) and what our total was, as that information wasn't readily available, a bus boy comes over and starts cleaning our table under us which I mean he could have at least waited until we walked away but ok? ANYHOW the reason for the 2 stars is the food was to friggin die for. The ribs fell off the bone just cause you looked at em. Perfectly cooked and tender pork, sauce was just sweet enough, the spicy was just spicy enough. The Mac and cheese was top 5 all time great. I really wish I could have taken the remainder of my meal. I want to give this place more stars because the food is THATS good but the service was so absolutely terrible I'd likely never go again as an eat in patron. I've been in food service a long time, and I let a lot of stuff most people would actually complain about go because I know how it is but WOW. (I was in there when there was 3 bar patrons and four 2 top tables, so by no means busy, at all, it was 1:30pm on a Tuesday)

oOetjYE09S433nMeb2kC1Q.text: Look, being from Texas, I love bbq and have tried it all around the country and some do it good, some do it well and some do it not so good. Walters BBQ, does not do it well. First off, it was a cold late afternoon and waited for 30 minutes to eat inside. No heat lamps whatsoever were in plain site or used for that matter for an outdoors option. It was either wait or eat in the cold. The atmosphere is so loud inside that you cannot hear your guest speak and you have to up your volume just to talk and hear. Then the food. I had the brisket sandwich while my guest had the turkey. The turkey was dry and no seasoning on it whatsoever. So bland. I had the brisket sandwich. So much salt was used on it that I could not finish it. It came with fries, but real  bbq places give you the choice of a side. I had to add-on the potato salad. The potato salad was way too creamy and not enough potatoes in it. The sweet tea was food, but way too much sugar. The service though was impeccable. Our server was great. Overall, if you like real bbq, don't come here. If you like sports and okay bar food, this is the place to be. A lot of TV's to watch the games and lots of alcohol to get buzzed, but not real BBQ is served here.

yH2Mov7a9nxsGiYQpiB-8w.text: This restaurant created a second yelp page with phony reviews because their first one was getting so many bad reviews. Look up Walter's Barbecue on Yelp.

tDlg38Sp4JcMV6CJMS383g.text: Walters is AMAZING!!!! Had the steel Mill Brisket and it was fantastic. If you ever in Lawrenceville, you MUST stop by. The service is great, and the ambiance is pretty good.

dxSJMjxRlApqFGQOVgAAdQ.text: This place does not even deserve one star. I never write reviews, but I think people need warned before trying out this place. I understand that it's new and sometimes places need some time to get some things figured out, but this was by far the worst dining experience any of us ever had.  Great concept horrible, horrible experience. First, we tried calling for about an hour and no answer. Then, we waited 1.5 hours for table and after telling us table was ready the staff gave it away to another party.  Waited another 20 minutes. Once we got seated we waited yet another 20 minutes to be greeted by waitress after getting sat. We actually had to ask for a waitress to come over.  Another 30 minute wait for drinks. Out of almost everything we asked for to eat.  Our waitress came to table maybe 2 times the entire evening. No silverware, no water, no napkins were given to us until we either grabbed it ourselves or asked other members of staff.  Not all of the food came out until we asked for it.  Beans were awful, queso and nachos were sad looking. Portions were small and we all left hungry. If our waitress was any good she would have given us a heads up on how much food to order and what her favorites were. Did I mention that our waitress was the worst!!!! Didn't hear an apology from waitress once. Her attitude was horrendous and she either needs retrained or fired. Would never recommend this place to anyone. Was excited to try this place and love how dog friendly it is, but I will not be returning and I advise you not to waste your time.

mFAOs377G0wLjZKu2hAHOw.text: Horrible service. Everyone  working there didn't seem to know what was going on/what they were doing. Waited over an hour to get seated, then another hour to get food. Once our food came the waitress didn't bring us silverware and she told us there wasn't any silverware clean and she would bring some out which took another 15 minutes, so our food was cold. Food was okay but nothing special. South Side-esque 20-something douchey/annoying scene with loud annoying music. Overall: No.

_ymrilonC056FbjhzudkeQ.text: Half the menu was unavailable.  Ordered drinks and waitress didn't return for 20 min.  Went to bar and stood there trying to order drinks for another 20 min before giving up and leaving.  Left after 40 min not having ate or drank anything.  Staff extremely disorganized and not customer friendly.  Awesome outdoor atmosphere but clearly very poorly managed

FtVq1COf0DYTTvLoYPBw2Q.text: Great BBQ.  Got to sit inside which was great considering other reviews.  I had the 1/2 smoked chicken.  I order this in a lot of restaurants and this was the best I've had.  Chicken was not dry and I like how they cut the chicken into pieces which made it easier to eat.  My friend had ribs and loved those.  We had mac and cheese and slaw for sides-- both delicious although the mac and cheese could have been warmer-- but not a big deal.  Our server was very knowledgeable about the beer and the food.  The BBQ sauce was good-- I loved the sweet and my friend loved the hot.

dX0nzEuBFEFj0ZPXKv8Vgg.text: Awesome food, atmosphere and staff! Very welcoming and everyone was super attentive! The brisket is tender and has all of the seasoning you need. Wings were moist but crispy on the outside! Awesome flavor balance. Make sure to try the sides, especially the Mac & cheese!

nIm2yclgw4t-na4l-QXYtg.text: FINALLY made it to Walters! Came for brunch and can't wait to get back for dinner. The chicken & waffles were deeeelicious!! And brunch is served until 4:00!! Give this adorable spot in L'ville a try if you haven't yet been! Friendly and helpful waitstaff too!

GTmcIWnG9SzQhPpNf9SUiw.text: Hosted a friend's birthday party here and the staff went above and beyond to make sure it was a success! From interior decorator to professional photographer and even a dog rescuer they help make the day very special. The amazing food and drink selection was just icing on the top!

sSpYSuFm2OIcqK5U0ZxMxw.text: Walter's has some serious issues in its current state. I've been there twice and both times I left unsatisfied. The first time I was there, they didn't seem to have a grasp on how much BBQ they needed to prepare in a day. We ordered three items before finally getting one they claimed to still have. Except when our food came out they replaced it with ribs because they ran out of that too and considered it an upgrade (without asking). The service was also slow and out of the loop. The second time I went was for lunch, however we learned despite their website stating they're open at 11am, they aren't. The staff was also pretty rude about us trying to walk in while it was closed (there are no doors and no apparent closed sign). Their loss on a group of 6 guys that work right up the street. I'm going to give this one a few months and see if they get their act together. I'll be checking out spork pit and sugar and smoke in the meantime.

Ab8ojpr6J_RJsvC1TFmKgQ.text: The atmosphere outdoor space is incredible. The food is absolutely amazing And one of a kind. The tacos are absolutely delicious!!! Smoker is the BOMB!! I can honestly highly recommended and will be back again and again

IcaEosRHQd5apWns0Ea43w.text: Visiting PA and came with friends. First food - BRISKET is what I had and you should too - delish! Next, VIBES, VIBES, VIBES!!  The layout is the best, I love this space and wish it were my backyard, could easily have any alfresco event here - wood everywhere and tastefully curated wood! Will come back when I'm back in town.

AaIG9aDffvPpCw2wAC45wg.text: I was very happy about the fact that this establishment is dog friendly because I have a pup that I was able to bring inside. My only complaint is that they hand customers a menu that is not actually the full menu served on a Saturday night. The staff should specify which food is available on which night. If all food were Available on all nights I would ess I give five stars.

aWhCxa8vHo_0KFIsQQV-aQ.text: Service was great and the food was good, but there was a lot that disappointed us.   First, we got there at 3pm on a Saturday excited to try the brisket. They informed us that they only do brunch until 4pm on Saturday's-- seemed a bit odd, but we stuck around anyways.   Beer selection is nice, but a little pricy. $7-8 for a craft beer when most places (even in Lawrenceville) you could find the same thing for $6.   Our food prices were both $13, and given the size, I thought it was a little overpriced.   In all, we got two $13 meals and two $7 beers based off the menu prices. Now, simple math would tell you that this is $40, or $42.80 after tax. They don't give you a paper itemized bill, and my total was somehow $44.55. I didn't think anything of it until after the fact; I wish looking back I would've said something to the waitress.   But the worst part about it is she told us that any change over $0.50 gets rounded to the nearest dollar. So instead of $44.55, we were now forced to pay $45. I know it's just a few cents, but... that sounds pretty illegal?  Just a heads up for you all.   It's a tight squeeze for indoor seating, with all of your utensils, sauces, and paper towels shoved on a tiny table, but maybe this place will be worth it during the summer with their outdoor seating and if we could get a chance to try their BBQ. It'll probably be awhile until I'd be willing to give the place another try.

o6vapTJrPZSKlWNX7WzueA.text: Average BBQ restaurant. Nothing extraordinary in my opinion. The service could be faster/better. Better to go in the warmer months when you can sit outside at the picnic tables.  However, in the colder months the they have tents and heat lamps covering the outdoor dining space.

Gdm1hGk7ivtkZBGkVo1AhA.text: Ok buckle up and hop aboard this runaway train.  Holy cow was this an "experience" and an exercise in patience to say the least. I met up with some friends from out of town at Walter's.  They arrived first and got a table on the patio (which is really great and would be a lot of fun as just a biergarten type of situation in the summer).  It was quite awhile before we saw a server or any staff at all, really...  When the server came to take our drink orders I asked if they had a cocktail menu...Spoiler alert:  they didn't have one, so I just ordered a Moscow Mule (which was pretty much all lime and melted ice with no ginger beer...).  My husband and friends ordered beers, which they were out of at least 3 of the 8 or so potential drafts.  Took probably 15 minutes to get our drinks.  Another 30 or so minutes pass before we get to order.  It was still pretty early, maybe around 6 - 6:30, and they were out of 75% of their BBQ offerings which was really disappointing and, frankly, a bit bizarre.    Actually receiving our food was a total disjointed process and took an unforgivably long time.  Nothing came out together.  We are pretty sure they gave my friends' wings to the table next to us.  I ordered a pulled pork sandwich, but got pork belly instead.  Apparently no one told us that they were out of pulled pork, too, but took the order anyway and just didn't mention it.  I grabbed a side of mac and cheese and it was the weirdest, rubbery-ist (?), conglomeration of congealed cheese.    Pretty much the only saving grace to this whole experience was the fact that the waitress was super nice to our pupper and brought him a water bowl.  It was a really sweet gesture, especially since everything else was a hot dumpster fire mess.  I have to say that I did feel bad for our waitress.  You could tell she felt mortified for having to tell everyone there was no BBQ at this BBQ place and she was definitely understaffed.  We were taken back by her attitude at first, but overall I give her credit because she was trying to put out a 4 alarm fire with a can of La Croix.  So waitress....I commend you for not totally losing your cool and walking out because I don't know if I would have been able to take it.  Bottom line:  if you come here, come with zero expectations.  Actually, on second thought, come with less than zero!  That way when they have a few things available from their menu you will be surprised!  I would also budget your time appropriately because you may be in for a really long experience.  Would have given 1 star, but the atmosphere is cool so...2 stars.

IzFOIl1poaj3D5da2lN86w.text: This place was fun. What I wasn't expecting was that it was fun and the food was amazing.  We came for brunch. My daughter had the chicken and waffles. They were the perfect mix of spicy and sweet. I had a breakfast sandwich with ribs, I mean, what could possible go Wrong?!? It was perfect. Our server was perfect.

6gsOO78A4xdtGhE37bzFoQ.text: Stopped by to get take out.  The bartender was great and busy.  He made sure I was updated and asked a couple of times if I wanted a drink or just some water while I waited for my order.  As with most BBQ joints they do not always have some items because they an only smoke so much at a time but most of the menu was available.  Also since they just opened it must be hard to calculate the amount of food needed.  My order of the Brisket sandwich came with fries.  The Brisket was chopped with some sauce and slaw had a nice flavor.  The fries were good too.  It did take a little longer then I expected to get my order, the kitchen seemed to be a little slow.  Will definitely stop back and try a few other items.

Jptki0EjQFgQspPeTlmnjA.text: We were greeted by a very friendly host who led us to a small table in the back of the restaurant. The table next to us was so close that I had to walk sideways between our table and the adjacent table to be seated. After browsing the menu we realized that you cannot order a combo plate such as meat & sides.. you had to order each individually $$. For example, a side of cornbread was 3.00 and it was worth about $0.15. It was dry and maybe 4 bites ( if you have a small mouth ). I had the pulled pork and it was ok.. nothing to write to Yelp about.  If you care about sustainability in the least, forget about this place. Each order is served in a paper throw away container and the napkins are a roll of paper towels. The only reason that I gave this place any stars at all is because the aesthetic is cool and the beer list was enticing- make this your group's drinking spot and leave it at that.

VTRb04Y17zXshqoi5Ft5Nw.text: I love the backyard vibe and food at Walter's but in a half a dozen visits I have not once had even decent service. I keep trying it again thinking they just need time to get the hang of being open but honestly there has been 0 improvement since the beginning. The drinks always taste watered down, my fiancee is never served the correct beer, usually we don't even get our food. If you bring a mistake to their attention they do try to fix it but I shouldn't have to reorder my food 5 out of 6 visits. I want this place to be good so badly but it's like they don't realize that being a restaurant means serving guests. A lot of wasted potential which is a huge bummer.

0VmwnpCVNs5BCpGzMY1x5A.text: Super fun vibe on a nice summer day but don't expect much in the way of service - every time I've been there I have experienced horrible service, whether it's busy or not. The food is average, definitely not great barbecue and definitely not good southern food. Also don't like that the very limited brunch menu goes until 4pm. If you're there to play cornhole, ping pong, or jenga on a sunny day, great! If it weren't for the terrible service and subpar food, Walter's would get 5/5.

TpN5ZIPYo2OTglfndqdc0A.text: The first time I visited Walter's was on Memorial Day, so I wanted to visit again to give a fair review, away from the chaos of being open on a holiday. Having visited yesterday, I can say safely that absolutely nothing changed. The restaurant has a fantastic outdoor area right on Butler Street, complete with picnic tables, some tent seating, porch swings, bean bag chairs and spot just for corn hole. The indoor area has booths, a few tables, and bar seating, but the front lawn (of sorts) is the obvious hub of activity. Unfortunately, here is where the restaurant's problems begin.  All this chaos must be controlled, but absolutely NO table service system exists at this place. The host/hostess stand was in two different places between my two visits. On Memorial Day, my table waited 25 minutes for a waitress to appear. This was after I asked the hostess if we were supposed to order from the bar. I let this infraction slide - no one wants to work Memorial Day and the place was a zoo. On a Tuesday night, however, we waited 10 minutes for a waiter to appear. The server himself was very friendly and helpful, but he was clearly lost among the jumble of people, and he was either stretched too thin or given no structure. Five or six draft beers were gone and not replaced with anything, and I probably drank half as much as I normally would due to our server being MIA.  On the bright side, the food is delicious. On Memorial Day, I ordered chicken & waffles and my friends ordered catfish tacos and mac & cheese. All were hot, savory, and delectable. However, yesterday, my friend waited 45 minutes for chips and queso. It would have been faster to drive to Qdoba and back. Seriously. I would recommend Walter's if you're looking for great BBQ and a great atmosphere, but not if you're looking to do anything else that day.

3b0I80BfyTGuZnCofAcZKQ.text: This place was fairly disappointing. The atmosphere is cute, it's like a little backyard barbeque. The drinks were good, I got a pineapple jalapeno margarita that was tasty.  As for the food. Meh. I got the ribs, which I ordered a half pound and was brought literally two bones. I thought for sure they rang my order in wrong, but no. The meat itself was good, but nothing to write home about. My husband got the pulled pork, also good, nothing exciting. The side-dishes we're awful. I couldn't even finish the Mac n cheese, which is saying something because I never like to waste food. It tasted like boxed Mac n cheese someone dumped salt onto. My husband got the baked potato and honestly I don't know how you ruin a baked potato, but it tasted like someone microwaved it, but not all the way. Also the barbeque sauce was eh. Needed more spice.  Service was meh, as well. The order took forever, which it was pretty busy, but we sat for 20 mins before our server even acknowleged us.  For what we paid, the food was absolutely not worth it, and it's really disappointing. I love me some good barbeque, and this just wasn't it. It seemed more to me like someone trying to cash in on a hipster neighborhood than to give some honestly good barbeque.

pIggVF4al5zlij96R-5OMg.text: I was sooooo shocked to try this place. I am SOO picky about barbecue, you know it never taste like granny's home cooking. But to my surprise this place was superrr close! I love that you can bring pets there and I LOVE LOVE LOVE the brisket. Please try this place if your thinking about it. I love it!

Q_ZL7BAEMfm6Dnq1mNIkwA.text: We had chicken, pulled pork, brisket, Mac and cheese, coleslaw, potato salad, collards, and corn bread. All delicious. Great beer menu, great atmosphere.  The corn bread was delicious but not worth the price. Should come with the meal.

DZovwhrRqN1782Q5feuAfw.text: Awesome outdoor seating space!  Brisket is amazing, loved the potato salad and a solid beer selection!  Friendly and quick wait staff, highly recommend!

At5N_NfKDQG6U7BSd3P0fQ.text: Let me just say l was super excited to try this place -- l lived in Nashville for 4 years and my partner is from Texas -- we like BBQ.   But, we just walked out after sitting at our table for 45 minutes waiting on our order to come out. And the waitstaff was not apologetic about it AT ALL. I cannot even tell you what the food is like because I never got to taste it.   Order came out and the food was accidentally given to the table next to us who were seated long after us. When we asked on an update we were told that this is just how long the wait is, everything is made fresh, etc. When the table next to us identified that their order was wrong (duh!) the waiter realized what happened and put two and two together and came over to apologize.   What he did next floored me. He took an order of the candied bacon off of the other table and brought it over to ours!!! I am sorry but that is a no-no. I was disgusted and couldn't believe it. I will not be coming back.   PROS: + off street parking lot + fun vibe on the patio + pet friendly? (There was a cute dog on the patio) + lots of TVs playing college football games  CONS:  - staff attitude - hygiene/cleanliness  We get it mistakes happen, sure we are all human and this is a newly launched restaurant, but the attitude of the waitstaff and the audacity to give us food off another table. GROSS!

iCu6Sgy33oGhdedOo_l5uw.text: I have to say that I was super excited to give this place a try.  I get my haircut across the street and am always met with this aroma of smoked meat perfuming Butler Street.  My parents came in from Chicago for Easter weekend to hang out with me and had never been to Pittsburgh.  So I knew I was going to be in Lawrenceville and we gave Walters a try this morning for Brunch.  I must say, it was by far one of the best brunch experiences in the Burgh thus far.  Everything was amazing.  Both my father and I had the Fried Chicken Biscuits and Gravy.  So freaking good and everything you think it should taste like but so much better.  My mother had the Brisket Skillet and she said it was one of her favorite brisket dishes she has had.  The service, amazing and attentive. I ordered my meal with no eggs, not for an allergy but because I don't really like them.  My meal came and the gentleman asked if I wanted something else as a side, like a hash?  I could not turn down a hash. That was just the extra step they took without me even asking.  The meal, the service, the atmosphere, and of course the amazing weather made this a great culinary experience.  I will be recommending this place to any all.

JfXlqi3jNsuuxNsvkh0Bnw.text: My BF and I attended their soft opening on 8/31. It was a nice day, but we opted to sit in the bar area due to it being very sunny in the yard/picnic table area. They had a great array of music playing, although I would've turned it down just a bit since it was hard at times to have a conversation. They had a good portion of their regular food menu items (no tacos though, which we both wanted). The drink menu was limited; they had a handful of beers and two cocktails that our waiter had written down on a piece of paper.  We each got a sandwich-Brisket and pulled pork respectively which both had some slaw on. They were very good. (One minor suggestion: place bottles of BBQ sauce on the tables. Both of our sandwiches could've used just a bit of sauce.) The hand-cut/homemade steak fries were delicious and the man Mac n Cheese we shared was to die for! We finished our food and chilled on the patio rockers and swing in the front of the bar/restaurant, which I love this idea. It's such a warm, friendly and lively environment.  I took a star off for a few reasons. Although it was a well put together soft opening, a few minor changes might've helped a bit. 1. Print temporary menus with available food and drinks for the soft opening so people don't order what you don't have. Also,  so I don't have to use the waiters written down drink menu. 2. Make sure there's a lock on the unisex bathroom door. My BF got walked in on while in there.  We can't wait to go back and try other items on their full menu! We're glad you're here, Walters! Kudos to an awesome and authentic BBQ!

5IHfyTC1-tHVVsWamnb24g.text: Don't know what people aren't liking about this place. The food is excellent; brisket, pork belly and corn bread are amazing. Venue is interesting but we are here for the food. It is great. Sauces are great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

tQvKs2_Wf1uMCNSVdT5Fcw.text: Walters- We visited on a nice day, so  we did enjoy the outdoor area and seating. Major plus one star for the atmosphere that has been designed and cool outdoor space. Shared seating does subtract from this however, I spent my dinner listening to the overly loud, obnoxious young 20 something woman next to me whine to her father about all her life problems.   Aside from the cool outdoor area, nothing else notable or much more than average. Food was marginal, service not so great. Chips and queso as an appetizer was very , very disappointing. Tasted like a bag and jar option served up rather than homemade. Queso should be white...chips crispy and fresh not stale. Side dishes were okay but not notable. The best thing we ordered was potato salad.   If this restaurant is going to survive in Lawrenceville and gain repeat customers,  improvements need to be made in menus,  quality,  thoughtfulness of preparation, and service. The outdoor area can only carry the customer base initially and through the summer. Not sure if we would return.

nRUgxXPW9KLPtYPnh6V7yg.text: Hands-down the best smoked ribs I've ever had. This is also a great and unique late night spot with a large open area, a bunch of outdoor seating, bench swings, corn hole, parking and is also pet friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Late night shot of the bar. Great lighting and music!

ROk1nGqRgiLaPKnHEqo8bg.text: This place has great potential. We went twice opening week. Once the first day it was open at 5 pm and it was a little rough, but fine for a first day. Then we went again two days later at 7 pm and it makes me not want to go back for at least a month or two. They ran out of everything. Our waiter forgot to get us refills again and again. The chicken wings were undercooked. It was a very long wait for everything. The food here is good though minus those undercooked wings. I like the pulled pork and brisket. The fries are so good. The Mac and cheese is super odd. It has a very earthy taste to it. Not what I want in bbq joint Mac n cheese. It's not bad, but not what you'd expect it to taste like and I really could do without it and I'm someone that loves Mac n cheese.

xZcd3MYwZ3B5OYHqFRTAyw.text: Went to Walters on a rainy night.. Sat closer to the bar but still outside.. Decent vibe and a nice new indoor/outdoor concept that seems to be popular lately for some reason.. I enjoyed the smoked sausage and the candied bacon was amazing.. I hear they are renting for winter but I was cold the night I went.. The smoked chicken was undercooked... Next time i will try brisket..  The macaroni was good and had a nice crumble on top

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

PXHHC1DifumIVTF2TM2o3g.text: While on a family vacation to Pittsburgh, we stopped in to try some of their bbq.  I was so impressed with how delicious everything we got was! The turkey we got was so moist, ribs fell right off the bone and the candied bacon I couldn't stop eating! The star was the fatty brisket, it was like "meat butter" the best brisket I've ever had. The layout is one of a kind and they have a giant smoker in front for everyone to see how the magic happens.  I'm going to have to come to Pittsburgh more often just to come to this restaurant.   Thanks Walter's!

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

eqfsaCxQmoNAIfNyEO81_w.text: First time there and we enjoyed the atmosphere! The brisket fries were amazing! We weren't impressed with the pulled pork, brisket, coleslaw, or wings but we can't say they were bad, just not impressed. We didn't like the bbq sauce they had but that's just us. The service was fast and our waitress was awesome, she recommended her favorites and explained the options. The manager approached us and asked how things were and about the service. We will definitely be back!!

I7yoiQVk4D0FCfhwHHqVlg.text: If you are looking for a great place you can eat outdoors when the sun is out, look no further than Walters. Whether you go here for drinks (they have an impressive draft list) or the food, I've found over multiple occasions they are both fantastic. I would highly recommend trying the brisket sandwich, one of their specialties. Be careful if you order extra sides though, as they are quite generous with the portion sizes. I can eat quite a bit but struggled to finish the brisket sandwich with the Mac and cheese side (the Mac and cheese is good too). Naturally, with such good drinks, ambience and food it can get fairly busy around lunch and evening hours and you may end of having to wait a little longer for service, but it's very worth it. Also a good spot to have drinks and play corn-hole, they have multiple sets to use on the lawn!

KcgiZkHF8-oA4TVxblwcSQ.text: They always have cute dogs and the mango claws. Fun games. Service at the bar is a nightmare. Food is good enough. Lizzy is the best.

6kkTRrJVrsKyQJu9UGvpaA.text: We get there at 3:30 on a Saturday, and tell the bartender we'd like to order food. "We're only serving brunch right now. We don't serve our regular menu until 4." Okay, we'll wait, we say. 4:00 rolls around and we ask to order food. "Oh, our kitchen closes from 4-5 to prep for dinner." But the other bartender told us we can order regular food at 4. "She only works here a few days a week, so she doesn't know that we close for an hour on the weekends." Whyyy are you serving brunch till 4:00? That is way too late. Also, you're more than likely the busiest on the weekends, so closing your kitchen for an hour is completely ridiculous. Would never go back, not just because of that, but because the service our bartender provided even as far as trying to order drinks go, was completely awful.  EDIT: to address the owners comment: if it is clearly stated "in plain sight" on the menu and website, then how do YOUR OWN EMPLOYEES not know that???

RqXRmq-mrrysT1bZSttJDw.text: Good food but slow service and so loud by the bar that you can't talk to anyone.  Still, the games outside are cool and if we had sat out there it would have been easier to hear.

vceNEACrT2YDgmmispq60g.text: Weather permitting this is a fun spot. Great candied bacon and everything we ordered off the smoker was perfection. There's a bunch of games to play and fun atmosphere. Will be back.

An-bkgr2ZIRwL2B0muiYHw.text: Wish I could say if the food was good but this place has the worst service I've ever seen in my life. We were told an hour wait so we got some drinks and hung out. An hour and 30 later they keep telling us we are next. While we're drinking there are at least 5 tables around us that went 30+ minutes without being sat with people. We finally got the call our table was ready. The hostess points to the back of the restaurant and says okay just pick one of those tables. We sit down, ask the waitress for some menus and she says okay be right back. 20 more minutes go by and we are ignored so we ended up walking out. Do yourself a favor and don't put yourself through this if you're hungry. It's a mostly outside place so go for a drink as long as you don't mind spending 7+ on a beer. I really wanted to like this place but I'll never go back after that experience.

-2jf2oZwLxI4ztaififZmw.text: Even though the average age was 25 (and I'm over twice that), I'd come back. We waited 40 minutes for a table, but it was worth it. Everything we ordered was delicious, our waitress was great, and the vibe is fun. There are lawn games (though there were so many people, we never got to play), picnic tables, bench swings, and bean bags. It feels like you're in someone's cool backyard. I wanted to come here before the warm weather ends, and I'm glad we did (the indoor part looks small). Bonus points for having Arsenal cider on tap!

BcD9V-Vslnth1XGRxN1E2Q.text: Ordered the chicken and waffles. The quality of the waffles and chicken were great! Waffles were fluffy and large, and the chicken was cooked perfectly; the skin fell off nicely and it was crunchy and delicious. My only complaints are that the quantity of the chicken was a little too small for the price paid. Also the beers are a tad on the expensive side. One final suggestion - install fans! It was a hot day, and there were flies buzzing around my food. It comes with outdoor seating, but fans would certainly help out.

JUhcQvbxGb1ziZlPg3_CIg.text: Warm summer days are perfect for spending an afternoon at Walters to enjoy the sun, play cornhole, and drink beer with friends. Right in the heart of Lawrenceville, there are plenty of large picnic tables and even a tent for the fair haired among us! They have excellent barbecue with a smoker right out front as well. Even though there's lot of space this place gets pretty crowded on the weekends!

-EM3DAVUYP7o2jJeUmwQxQ.text: Parking is a True nightmare on and around Butler Street and there's no way to dodge that bullet. I found the parking log refreshing but it's a bit tight so be careful. I like the set up it's a BBQ joint with a lot of personality. I didn't partake but there was a swing and lots of picnic tables. I opted for a traditional table and enjoyed brunch. I had chicken and waffles. The food was very good. The mimosas were great and the price was right. They weren't too busy so we had no issue getting a table on a Sunday. I'd like to go back and try different menu items especially the brisket. It smelled great so I don't plan to wait long I love brisket. The service was fast and friendly and I think this place will do very well. Just have to be willing to park and walk because you may not find a spot close  by.

EaU5oKIZY88IxUFiyN0SCg.text: Not ready for the big time  First nice night of the spring they run out of just about every beer on tap as well as pulled pork.  When I think BBQ and customer service, Brooklyn doesn't come to mind, and my experience confirmed why.  Overall, they are running a rinky-dink, mickey mouse operation. 2 stars for location, negative 1 star for everything else.  Would not recommend.

w3maI9--vlyzrFFMtDuzcA.text: Walter's is the place to be, it was extremely crowded on a Friday night, so we were glad we made reservations ahead of time. We ordered drinks, the Texas Two Step was mostly bourbon, but still tasted good. The barbecue was flavorful and a good price for the quantity. Our house salad could have used more dressing. The corn bread was a crowd pleaser and we ordered extra. The bathroom was out of order, but the manager gave it shots as compensation. Definitely would go back when it wasn't so crowded for better service.

trR-D_jR-z3AUG5OiX5TNA.text: Nothing was working right in there. And every time you wanted a non alcoholic or alcoholic drink, they seemed to be out of it. And the portions of food didn't match what you paid for it. I've had better.

bYDNyk4XOGsYJk8p9NL3-Q.text: Never ever written a yelp review. Good food but our waitress was so rude. Her name is kaitlyn/Caitlyn. Got annoyed at us when we didn't know which beers were out of stock, sat at our table when taking our order, rushed our order, spilled water on our table and didn't say anything/clean it, generally just acted annoyed by our presence the entire night.

ggFZ7_lRCBLSbjj2QyI6tw.text: Walter's is hands down the best BBQ in Pittsburgh. When I first moved here, I was disappointed in the BBQ selection.  A few options came and went, but they all had issues. Too tomatoey of a sauce.  Too overdone ribs.  Nothing was great.   Walter's has come to the rescue. We had candied bacon, cornbread, fatty brisket, and ribs.  All were spectacular. Excellent smoke ring on the ribs and incredibly tender brisket. Ribs were tender and came off of the bone easily enough, but in no way came off on their own. Candied bacon had a touch of spice, as did the cornbread, which were both a pleasant surprise. To drink we had a Pizza Boy sour on draft, which was nice to see that they had a good beer selection on tap.   We'll love to come back when the weather is more cooperative, to check out some of the other seating options.

Sl16czfMS9iQ716hBiXeXw.text: I am not a fan of the pet friendly policy which allows all dogs especially inside the restaurant area around people food and drinks. Now outside in the summer time may be a different story. I was with a party of 6 and we were having a good time until we saw the dog which was eating food off the floor and the staff petting the dog. To top it off the owner picks up the dog and sat it on the bar. At this point I was ready to go! This was a complete turn off. As far the food the ribs and brisket was good.  The collard greens (which I ordered) is not a must try and neither is the mac n cheese (which 3 people ordered and all 3 disliked it).  I cannot forsee  me going back. And lighting is very dim so make sure you have a flashlight on your cell phone.

4SwF_8BfUo_4kvACscajHw.text: I went with friends for happy hour and the location is amazing. During the summer, it's so fun with the outdoor games, picnic tables, and the fact that it's dog friendly. The happy hour specials are pretty good- the tacos being 2 dollars was a steal. As for the food not during happy hour, a little bit on the pricey side for BBQ. The tacos were not bad, nothing special. The mac and cheese was alright, as was the cornbread. The margarita type drink (I forgot what it was called) that I got was really good.  The service was just alright at the very best.... Splitting checks was a huge ordeal and they seemed to have attitudes... Overall, I was a little let down, but this place has potential if they step up the service and either have more reasonable prices or make the food a lil better.

9AD7P7eydjlCFxcUTgkpfw.text: This place has MAJOR service issues that need to be addressed immediately.   I was there on a Sunday with some friends to eat and watch football. They have a great setup where you can sit facing the TVs but still be outside. Our waitress was very friendly but she was clearly overworked, and she made multiple mistakes. I noticed she did not write down any of our orders when she took them. Look, I'm fine with waitstaff keeping orders in their head, but if you do that, you basically get zero tolerance for mistakes in my book.   Lo and behold, our sides came out wrong, and we REPEATEDLY saw the food runner bringing the wrong food to the wrong table, bringing the wrong food to the right table, or even worse, coming out with food and having no idea where it's going. Meanwhile , I hate to say it but I saw bartenders/waitstaff texting on their phones while it was busy. To me, this is nearly as unforgivable as it gets. You are demonstrating to the entire restaurant that you don't care about the customers. I would mandate a no phone policy at least during peak times.  This place has great potential. The food was solid, the location is fantastic, and the atmosphere is fun. But the entire staff needs to be trained and organized ASAP. I look forward to trying again in a few months and hope I can write an updated positive review.

QCFXzyyzGeKh5aOzyyiFTg.text: Walter's has incredible food and wonderful service!  I hosted a surprise party during brunch for my husband in the tent and everyone so accommodating and it worked out perfectly!  It met all of our needs - great food, TVs for the fantasy football addicts, and kid friendly with lots of activities to keep them occupied!  I would highly recommend Walter's for 2 or 20!

PAI6t7KbcOWeIXvf7f-grQ.text: Message to Ken R. Complaining about brunch on Saturday. People like brunch. I know you called it breakfast but it's brunch and if you look at the website you'd see it's served until 4pm on Saturday. I love this restaurant and hate that a negative review was given because you're unable to check the site like an adult.

FkF0Ik5CQ5-naSBYP0arbA.text: Really cool place with really good food. We played cornhole out front while we waited for our table to be ready. It was busy (Saturday evening). Outdoor seating is their main space. The fatty brisket was delicious and the pulled pork was really good. The barbecue sauce is fantastic with a bit of tangy-ness. The cornbread has jalepeno bits mixed in but was alright, nothing special. The Mac and cheese, collard greens, and potato salad were all on point. Sadly, the sweet tea was not. It basically tasted like unsweetened tea that they dumped sugar into. Definitely not authentic southern sweet tea. Having said that, that is my only complaint. The atmosphere was fun and the food was great. We'll be back.

pK2-OxHtOY9Y5BzUXcwr5g.text: Food was very good and I would venture to say excellent.  Service was awful, a shame since the place has so much potential.  Ate at the bar not very busy since it was a Thursday, bartender had 0 sense of urgency.  Will most likely return to experience the food but if the service continues to be this bad I will start to look elsewhere.

mvBczAhL_HsSYfEgN3hWJQ.text: Had dinner at Walters 2 evenings ago. They were out of both house wines and also 2 menu items we had ordered. The server had to keep coming back telling us they were out of this and out of that. On our way out one of my friends knew an owner/manager(?) and pointed out that they were out of quite a few things. He asked what, she told him and he laughed and said "Oh yeah, that's right, we are." Another woman who was sitting with him also laughed and said, "Yeah, I just placed that order today". No apologies, no concern regarding our dissatisfaction. We were not rude to them. We will never go back. And, BTW, the brisket was dry.

CIBXbTb3Z5IFNikhWk6p0g.text: The price is far too high for the quality of food, which is average. Walters wouldn't survive in a BBQ town like Austin. There are better alternatives for smoked meat on Butler St if you look around. The big thing this place has going for it is that it's animal friendly, it's nice to be able to sit outside with a beer if you have a dog - that's the only reason I find myself going occasionally, although they seem to sell out of half of their drink menu and are usually always out of meat well before the kitchen closes. I work close by and rarely see the same server twice, which I can't imagine says good things about what it's like to work there.

DzLTza1xzwv-0rKbwMY6rQ.text: I drive past this place on the way to work, so the whole time they were building it I couldn't wait for it to open so I could try it! Me and my friend stopped in and sat at the bar, it was a little after they opened so it wasn't that busy yet,( It was completely full by like 630) and our visit started out great. They have great happy hours deals on drinks and food both, had a great margarita, and they have good beer selection.   So when we went to order food though, it started with "were out of this, this, this and this tonight". Annoying but okay you just opened the business and maybe they're working it out and they gave a heads up atleast. So we ended up ordering candied bacon, a side of their reg Mac (they were out of other 3) and me and my friend ordered two tacos a piece.   First the bacon comes out-good flavor but it's ice cold. Hate complaining. So we don't say anything. Then about 5 mins later my tacos come out. I ordered pork tacos that the menu listed as coming with Pico, Chile sauce, cojita cheese and crema.. when they come out though, it's pork and huge pieces of raw red onion. That's it. I don't care for onion so I purposely ordered ones without. If it would have had all the things it said PLUS onion, okay I'll pick it off but it was plain. At this point I think, okay I'm a paying customer so I say to the bartender I'm not sure this is what I ordered (thinking maybe it was someone else's) but so they remade them for me. Even after that my friend still has yet to her her food. Another 15-20 minutes. My tacos are gone and she's still waiting. We ask and they check on it, finally they come out maybe 5-10 after that and say they lost the ticket.   The owner did come out and apologize and sent us free chips and two different queso dips which were good. (Which was also a little weird though because we were unaware it was for us and the guy behind the bar just kept walking around auctioning them and no one had ordered any so everyone said those arnt ours. Eventually they got sent back out for us and said this is on the house.)   I hate complaining. I've been a waitress for 7 years and I know things happen, front and back of house alike. But just very disappointing food experience.  All in all, great place to drink! Beautiful outdoor space. Staff was very nice, And maybe a slight chance of giving the food a second go in the future when they've been open longer and work out kinks, but the food scene in pittsburgh is on point right now and there's so many other places to try!

_kwH2f7O6J5t9FU4qbZ6lw.text: The service is a little on the slow side. They always out of something BUT the fatty brisket... OMG!!! INCREDIBLE. Best ever. If your a brisket connoisseur.... get your ass down there!!!! You'll forget anything bad about the place after the fatty brisket.

IpCJNEwHmNi-zh_ffEvhXg.text: Our family of six arrived at approximately 2:00PM on a Saturday. They were only serving the breakfast menu!  We left. Boys wanted pulled pork, which we heard was good, but I guess we'll never know. When do you think you could actually order something other than breakfast?

qjNUCWCQby_0gO8RYvVw-g.text: No Bloody Mary available at 11:30am? Just ran out... it's a Saturday folks. Ya just opened. Brunch menu only is fine, however, no brisket for the two brunch items that include brisket.  Can I have a napkin to cry? I'll try one more time and hopefully it is much better...

Zf11T1_JJj7QF2GSP3fUIQ.text: Amazing restaurant and atmosphere! They went above and beyond for our 20 person group. The pulled pork and macaroni and cheese were delicious!!! Nice addition to Lawrenceville and the burgh.

1iTSFHFQ4X3eagUHelVb_A.text: This place is top notch! Took a weekend trip to Pittsburgh and was really surprised about how cool this spot was. There's a huge outdoor seating area with plenty to keep you occupied. Great beers on tap and a solid bourbon selection. Don't skimp on the mac and cheese! So good. Both of the owners took the time to stop by the table and see how everything was which was a really cool personal touch. Definitely check this spot out.

Egj6ghhAowXwtSjhOWJRDw.text: They accommodated a short notice reservation for 30. My guests loved the food, service, and beer. And the Texan even commented it was the best collard greens he's ever had.

S51hA56DNxKn1KN_fZU5Rg.text: Me and 2 friends went there to eat. My ribs were so tough i couldnt even swallow them. My friends got the pulled pork which they said was good. Our meal with sides cost well over $70.00 and they couldnt even give us nice plates or silverware we got paper plates and plastic forks. This is what turned me off 100% from ever going back, we paid for our meals with a credit card but left a hefty tip in cash on the table for the waiter, when he took our card for payment and noticed no tip on the receipt he ran after us to the sidewalk and commented in a rude voice, " what no tip" ! We politely said your tip was left on the table. I felt attacted and insulted by the unprofessionalism of this particular waiter which on top of the subpar meal topped my evening. I know its not all the owners fault but i wont risk the insults and return

27kFcaJRo2kL64q4aTgiiQ.text: Despite its hipsterish nature, this place is on fleek lol. Part of the hipster charm is the casual nature- paper plates, rolls of brown paper napkins and they keep it daaaaark. Like for anyone 35 an up you need to use a flash light to read the small print on the menu lol. Their main focus is Texas BBQ, serving brisket, ribs, chicken, turkey and pork belly. Everything comes without sauce, but there are two on the table to try. I got the hamburger cause it's my personal goal to try the hamburger at every new restaurant we try, but the rest of the fam got a bunch of different things to split. The meats come in 14,  1/2 and 1lb (or half/whole birds) which is nice because you can get a couple meats to try. The chicken & ribs were amazeballs, I thought the brisket was slightly dry. The sides- potato salad, greens, mac'n'cheese and cornbread were all decent to great. The BF loved the potato salad which was a pink-ish color and tasted like it had a lil' something extra. I think that lil' something was ketchup, but whatever, he loved it. The mac'n'cheese was probably the best, with the greens a close second. The hamburger was on point. It comes with pork belly on it and in two thin patties. Normally I don't care for the thin patties, which can be dry, but it was juicy and delish. It also had a special sauce which kinda made it. The really super cool part is the lot is quite large and it looks like in the summer months they grow some of their own stuff and there is lots of outdoor seating!! Love that outdoor seating

OvmsjeIo3pg_Z8thVrOTcQ.text: Went to Walter's with a few family members and sat outside, the weather was really nice. We liked the vibe of the sharing tables - so different. Gives you a community feel and makes it feel like you are part of the crew u know. We ordered a lot of sides to share, cornbread being a fav and the mac & cheese. Now I didn't try the Brisket but everyone else went punk over how good that was. Sweet potato, collard greens and tacos for the vegetarians in our crew. All in all we had a great time. Oh, the music was fab, shout out to le DJ. Nice vibe and very cool staff.

9vc_x5_EtYXjCUqUHh-t2w.text: Had dinner at walter's while visiting friends in PGH.  Pulled pork was excellent, server was busy but friendly- didn't wait long for food or drinks, and we were a fairly large group.  Outdoor area was fun, glad we got to enjoy it on a beautiful day!

id_9tkh2u1xkQKY6ezmD_A.text: This place is a colossal mess. The only place you can find their phone number is on facebook. But dont try calling it because they dont pick up.  I called this place 5 times to place an order and it just rings.  I wanted to try their smoked wings so I ended up going to the establishment.  They have been open for a month now and when you enter its like walking into a chicken coup with their heads cut off.  No patron is there to greet you.  There literally is no order.  I walked in and had no clue where to go.  Terrible customer service.  The worst part was they dont even have their full menu available or any food.  They didnt have the smoked wings available which is just laughable.  Its wings come on. I wasted so much time and effort for nothing.  Avoid this place like the plague!

vFl1nhvYHEpea5kvDDx1LA.text: Tried to get food to go on a busy Friday evening but was turned off by rude waitstaff. Made it back in the following Tuesday right at open- 5pm. THEY DID NOT HAVE BRISKET READY. Tried ordering a few other things off the menu only to be cut short saying "we don't have that today"... We ended up ordering the turkey and sausage. The portion we received for the price was a bit of a letdown. This must be the Brooklyn factor coming in to play! The turkey was okay. I've had better bbq at a gas station, but that comes with the territory of being a native south Texan. The sausage was great! We wished the piece was bigger than a single link. Sauce was ok. A little peppery and tasted homemade. They should consider adding complementary sides of pickles and onions. I don't really understand how they plan to conduct business in the Pittsburgh winter. Indoor seating is limited to the bar and maybe 3 tables? Will visit once more and if they don't have brisket ready upon opening then it's 3 strikes you're out! I'll stick with Smoke!

asCCeWHFgknuAs5qizHY6A.text: A craving for BBQ and a curiosity about this new place drew me in to meet a friend for dinner and drinks during happy hour. The tap special was decent with a dollar amount off each draft and they had cheap tacos as well. However I opted out of the taco deal and for the brisket with a side of Mac and cheese. Both items were very mediocre. Of all places you'd think Mac and cheese would be excellent, I'd imagine a BBQ establishment would knock it out of the park, but this had little to no taste and was an unfortunate let down. With so many other places in the city doing BBQ these days, the presentation and taste did not compare.   But on the up side, the staff was pleasant and the atmosphere was fun and unique. I think in the summer months there is definitely a draw to come back once their large front patio is pack in action. I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon for dinner but wouldn't say no to grabbing a drink and enjoying their environment again.

W-Uj7FAB9CDuuP8rGN_JtQ.text: The food was just okay per the company I was out with but I'm willing to give it another try. I only had dessert, banana bread and it was okay. The environment wasn't at all a mixed crowd like I hoped. The games and cookout vibe were dope! They allow dogs (not just service animals) which made me itch as I imagine fleas around people eating but  hey. The waitress wasn't the best.

PJCy4W7GEjXXdCHkFBIhpA.text: We came here for the first time to celebrate a friends birthday on a Friday night-place was bumpin with people everywhere and dogs! Loved the cute dogs! It was so packed luckily we made a reservation or you wouldn't find a table. Around 8:30/9 there's more space outside to grab a drink and lounge, but if you're eating dinner you definitely need a reservation. The place was very unique with a cool vibe outside and pretty hipster in my opinion. They have games such as cornhole, connect 4, and ping pong going on which was neat! The drink selection had a nice variety, but was super overpriced. I ordered the Texas two step and it had a ton of bourbon in it-if you like bourbon get that! I also had the bad arse chicken for dinner and it was delicious! We ordered cornbread which was yummy and it came with a weird white sauce I could have passed on. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their food as well. Service was okay and our waiter was very friendly, but some of our orders didn't come out correctly or came out super late. I mean there were a ton of people there so it's understandable, but it was still a bit of lag time. There were a lot of bugs roaming around (we sat outside so we understand there will be some) but maybe they could get some citronella candles or something to help out with that for the outdoor are. Overall we had fun and would come back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

AFQ4LGtv1mmLQLCsQ6v5RA.text: When we came in after 8pm on a Friday it was bumpin. When you take out the outdoor area, it's a pretty small restaurant. Thankfully they set-up a tent that honestly looks like a large camper tent, in the front, so they've got you covered in the cold weather too!   I have been on a brisket kick, so I ordered the smallest portion, 1/4 brisket. It was a pretty small size, mind you this was my second dinner (I know, I hate to admit that), so it was totally fine. If this is your first dinner, you might want to get the 1/2 portion. I also am obsessed with greens and got the 16oz side just for myself! I could have doubled the portion they were so good!   The brisket was good as well, but came out just a tad on the cooler side. I also ordered the lean, and am wondering if I should have just did it up and ordered the fattier ones. I do think it's a nice option to choose which cut you want. There are two kinds of BBQ sauce, a spicy and a sweet. My friend had the brilliant idea of mixing the two, and honestly, that was the perfect combo for me!   We also ordered hot spiked cider. I was super into the idea because my throat had been killing me for days. When we got the little mug with a cute cinnamon stick, it was lukewarm. Not my idea of a hot toddy. Our server was so super nice and reheated them for us. Once they came back, it was perfection. They have a solid list of local beers, but the menu just tells you what breweries they carry, so you have to ask your server the specific kind of beer, since they're not printed.   I'd love to come back and work my way through the meats menu. The server was telling us the meat smoker dude gets up at 2:30am just to start smoking the meats. That's insane, and some dedication to the craft.

3NxiS0H094PNjf1ovVxQOA.text: Came here with coworkers for some drinks on a Friday night. The atmosphere of the restaurant is really cool with outdoor tents and porch swings. Inside they have a smaller drink list than I expected from a place as large as it is. I ordered an Arsenal Snowbound Cider and was shocked to be charged $9 when the bar and bowling alley we went to previously had drinks for much cheaper. The bartenders were quick to get all of our orders and checked in on us as the night went on and we hung out near the bar. Definitely its unique look and interesting atmosphere are what makes this place cool. I am interested in how it will be in the summer, if they will utilize the grass outdoor area for leisure activities.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

z5z6oEeZLJtnVRCSd5E_DA.text: Such amazing food! Literally everything on their menu is phenomenal. The servers are great, very attentive and helpful. They allowed us to split our checks which was very nice because we had a group of 10.  The ambiance is amazing, I felt like I was at a rooftop party in NYC.  So many people from various backgrounds and ages having a great time and enjoying the food and company.  This is definitely a popular place, so get their early or just make sure you know that you will need to wait for a table.

Kr7Db98Je0JAUnVcWUPb7Q.text: Walking into Walters I was a little confused because they just told me sit wherever. I felt like I needed just a little bit more direction than that. After scanning the restaurant I was able to find a table for two and sat right down. It was a little bit louder in the actual inside restaurant than I was prepared for. But the atmosphere was very warm very friendly and the food was good.  Our server Zoey was so friendly and informative that it made the entire visit. She even gave us some good suggestions and told us to order soon because they might be running out. I like a server who tells you the truth about the food and also make sure that you get exactly what you want. Kudos to her.  We got a half pound of the fatty brisket, the collard green sides, and the mac and cheese.  The fatty brisket was very good and I preferred the spicy BBQ to their sweet BBQ. You could have eaten it without the barbecue but if you are going to go for a barbecue you might want to just try the spicy one. The brisket was cooked really well and had just enough amount of spices on it to make it flavorful and its own right.  The collard greens were delicious. With just a splash of vinegar and tang to go with the sweetness of the greens. They were perfect that night and when I ate them for lunch the next day.  The mac and cheese was not the star of the show. While it was good I prefer my Mac and Cheese to be more crispy at the top then this one presented itself. Well flavorful it just didn't have that crunch that I was looking for.  I look forward to try and more of their menu. And for the service alone I would go back.  My only complaint is that I don't like that they use paper plates and paper cups for all of their items. It just seems wasteful to me. And you can't bake mac and cheese to get a crispy top if you're putting it into a paper cup. Paper plates or cups are good for to go but not if you're going to be sitting down in the restaurant to eat. That's my only complaint.   I'll be back, because I want to try their smoked wings.

EkiojbpZDhowJpUlo-QquA.text: Food is always delicious. The service is poor. Uninterested staff, brought appetizer the same time as the dinner, never came back to ask for more drinks. Love the food, but not sure I'd return.

63XtFUgfkpf8IwPw8tb4aQ.text: Great concept - however I think they have a few kinks to work out. I'm a huge lover of brunch and when I found out there was going to be a bbq place that offered brunch I was so pumped to try it.   I was surprised to see that they had a parking lot which is rare for lawrenceville. The first thing we were told was there were 2 brunch items they didn't have. One of those items I wanted to try, but ended up choosing the brisket hash and eggs. The brisket was cut into cubes and mixed in with the hash browns. I was very happy with my decision and would like to give dinner a try. There are not a lot of sauce options; only two to be exact (sweet and spicy). I preferred the sweet.   We were also told that you can only split the checks 2 ways and there was 3 of us. It's 2018 and a majority of people use cards these days. This is one of my biggest pet peeves and I think it's an inconvenience to your customers. Like I said I'd like to give the dinner menu a try, but I will give it sometime before rushing back. I can definitely see this place thriving in the spring and summer months as long as they work out the operational issues.

nRsivbJuVNDgfbaolOUMFA.text: Made a reservation. When we got there they had none. We showed them our confirmation text. They put us at a table next to the restroom. Nobody came to wait on us so we asked the hostess for help. We waited ten more minutes and left. Had nice dinner at The Abbey. Recommend skipping the chaos and rudeness.

2aQIc-fEW65pHEVqyk4QhA.text: Food was only fair and service was HORRENDOUS. Waited at the bar for almost 10 minutes before the bartender acknowledged us. Ordered 2 cocktails off their list(that only has 4 total cocktails) and was told they couldn't make one. We ordered a glass of prosecco instead. The prosecco was sitting out, opened, and was flat and warm. Tried to order food but the first 2 things we wanted, they were out of (turkey and tacos.. which can only be ordered during happy hour).  Ended up placing a different order. Ribs were flavorless and pulled pork was mostly fat. The cornbread, mac&cheese and chicken was very good though. The owner (I assume) came behind the bar because the bartender couldnt keep up. She made a beautiful cocktail and we asked what it was....turned out it was the one we were told they "couldn't make". She apologized and said she would make us one on the house. When we asked for our check, the bartender (who never apolgized for lying or never checking on us) said he "got our last drink" as if we should be thankful he didn't charge us for the drink the owner made us after he wouldn't. All this on a weeknight when it wasn't very busy. The owner and the sides are the only reason I give this place 2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

-fGTw8eLiwYKc9pG5H756Q.text: The food was good, but we the place lacks seating...inside. We were seated outside in a tent and yes, it was warm even when it was cold and rainy outside, but it was a TENT. The singular heater was positioned right behind us and would blast us when it kicked on. So we were either hot or freezing depending on when it was running. I'm sure that this place will be wonderful in the warmer months when the large courtyard area is more useable but we live in a climate that doesn't lend itself nicely to outdoor seating, porch swings, and yard games.   If you go, definitely order the pulled pork as it's delicious. The Mac and cheese was fantastically rich, as well.

mz4lN07aVN7fLtkVEQ7Fmg.text: 5 stars on the environment, it's like you're in Austin, TX. 5 stars on the staff, the bartender told bad jokes and think piece jokes!  5 stars on the food!!  Brisket, pork belly and all the sides were excellent!!

vY-lD2S9Ue_5vKkvLOJ27Q.text: Tonight is the 3rd time I've order Walters for delivery through yelp / grub hub. All 3 times the restaurant failed to accept the order. This is on different days. I really like Walters food, but this is pretty annoying. If you don't want to take delivery orders just take it off Grubhub. Update ... they accepted my order this time, but when driver gets there he's told they couldn't fulfill my order.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

pWTL3JZvzidLxplwHDVd_g.text: Eh. I've been really looking forward to this place opening up and I was mostly disappointed about my visit.  I went for lunch and was told that it would be a limited menu, that's fine but the way they tell you what's available is by pointing at things on the large dinner menu. They should really find a better way to showcase what they have available for lunch.  I would suggest using some sort of tablet where people actually see what they have versus what they don't have.    The service was average. I was disappointed by this since we were one of the only people there at the time.  We had to ask the waitress for things that we shouldn't have had to.  I also told her that there were a number of empty glasses scattered around the place and she just looked at them and walked away like it wasn't her job.   The food was the only thing keeping this from being a 1 star review.  That truly saved the day.

2x49oxZoD-jXz3t1QIrzKQ.text: Had high hopes, unfortunately there is better out there. Brisket sandwich was just a couple of cubed chunks of meat with too much BBQ sauce, the pulled pork sandwich had good texture, but no taste, not even any sauce, (non offered either) and the ribs barely had any smoked flavor. Even the seasoning was a little mild and weird. Did I mention the water was served warm? Loved the fries. Only thing going for it is the environment and location. Pecan Lodge in Dallas or Franklins in Austin this place is definite is not.

TDzmb3sm45VzcXOwJ8iqkA.text: Eh.. I hate to do this, but I'm writing this review with hopes that I can update my review in the future. Last night, I went to Walters with my fiance and two of our friends. My fiance and I got there first so we scoped the place to look for a place to sit. They have a huge outdoor area adorned with picnic tables. When we walked in, there were no open spots at the picnic tables so we ventured to the "inside area" (there are no doors, but it has walls and a roof, so it's sort of inside, but also pretty open at the same time. We were told we can sit anywhere, so we found ourselves a place. At about the same time we sat down, a couple of ladies sat in the booth right next to us. When we were seated, a waitress said she'd be right over. A few minutes later, another waitress came over and asked to take our drink order. My fiance asked if he could see a tap list. The waitress said they didn't have a tap list but rattled the beers off herself. Okay, that's fine. A little while later she came back with our drinks. I noticed that the ladies next to us had not been greeted or waited on yet. The waitress also brought menus over to us. When I checked out the menu, I noticed that a few things (which I was planning to try) had been taken off the menu I saw on Yelp pictures and replaced with other items. Okay, no big deal, I'll just try other things. By this time, the manager came over to our table and asked if we were ready to order-- told him we're still waiting for friends.   I'd like to point out that the ladies on the other side of us had not been waited on yet. One lady had to go to the bar and order drinks and ask for menus. By this time another couple was on the other side of us and they had not been greeted or waited on either at this point.   So the waitress comes back over and asks if we're ready to order. We said we were waiting for friends still. The waitress then informed us that they were out of all of the meats except the brisket, pulled pork, and sausage. They opened at 5 pm and this was at 7 pm...   Our friends finally showed up and we filled them in on what was and wasn't available. The waitress came over again and asked if we were ready to order. My friend asked the waitress which tacos they had available. The waitress informed him that they didn't have any tacos at all (they were on the menu). Then he asked what sandwiches they had available. All they had was the brisket sandwich and fried chicken sandwich (several others were on the menu). My friends both decided on the fried chicken sandwich, which came w fries and a side of potato salad. My fiance and I both ordered smoked wings (mine buffalo and his naked). I also ordered the house salad and was told that they didn't have that either (it was a salad on the new menu). So then I asked what the seasonal veggie was, which was also on the menu. They said they didn't have the seasonal veggie either. So my fiance and I both split a large order of collard greens.  He also tried the cornbread. Our wings came w blue cheese and I asked for ranch since I don't like blue cheese and was told that they didn't have ranch.  So, I gave Walters two stars because the food that we did get to try was good. Our wings had a good Smokey flavor. The buffalo and bbq sauce was very good too. Our friends enjoyed their chicken sandwiches and fries. However, they have ALOT of things to iron out. They had next to nothing on their menu. They also didn't do a great job of waiting on the people around us. The manager didn't seemed to fazed by this either. I thought he would at least go around and apologize to people for the wait and the limited amount of menu items.   So all in all, I wasn't thrilled with my experience at Walters. I really wanted to love it, and maybe I will in the future, but I was not impressed this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Brunch and kids menu
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Caddy that holds utensils, plates, napkins, cups and sauce. Neat idea!
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Smoked buffalo wings. Side of celery and blue cheese. They didn&#39;t have ranch.

H4MbQ0IzIqj8fAzhtWdo0Q.text: Went with extended family on a late Saturday afternoon,. The place had a crowd but seating was still available. The atmosphere was fun with lawn games, and toddler friendly. The apps a pretty standard, the BBQ wings were good. The brisket is good, not the best but good. I my opinion the brisket could have more smoke.  The Mac and cheese and collard greens were very tasty. I will be coming back.

fVDlEKDEpzLwuyqnsNhunQ.text: Stopped in during soft opening which means a limited menu. Too bad, I really, really, really wanted the chili cheese fries. But hey it's a reason to come back. I had the chopped brisket sandwich comes with slaw on it but I requested none. Roasted and buttered brioche roll. The meat was seasoned so well that I didn't want or need to put sauce on it. However, I needed to taste the sauces so I dipped in them and they were delish. The sandwich meat was tender and juicy. The fries were good, typical of this sort of establishment. Fresh cut potatoes can't go wrong. My boyfriend had the 1/4 brisket and it was just as delicious as the sandwich. Seasoned and cooked well. Washed it all down with Shiner Bock, Texas style. Nice layout indoors and out. Dog friendly. Looking forward to coming back when the full menu is available.  They have several style of macaroni and cheese that weren't available and I'm dying to try them all.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Chopped brisket sandwich and fries.
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Brisket.
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

Cud1otjH8vGc0VF3MwIMUQ.text: This place is awesome. The brisket was great with a really nice smoke ring.  I didn't really like the BBQ sauce that much but that's OK because the Smokey flavor of the brisket and ribs was so good I didn't really need much sauce! Both were prepared top notch!  Reminded me of Dreamland Ribs in Alabama!   Mac and cheese was good and the corn bread with some peppers in it was just right without being too hot.   I suggest you hit this place if you like bbq, it is a bit pricey, but any good q is going to cost you!  I'll be back!
