hwA8ytgnbKp1bZxbsmPahw.text: Ate the fatty brisket and pork belly. It was cooked really well. Nothing to as dry.  The collard greens are nice - they have a slight vinegar flavor which surprised me. I liked it a lot.   Service is kinda shot though, pretty sure she forgot to put in our order, barely checked in, but it was busy - stuff happens. Food was good. Will probably do take out next time.

6hiNVd3see_xMh2e_oWiCg.text: Visited Walter's a Sunday afternoon and they were still serving brunch which was perfect. Walter's is a great place to visit if you're a bbq lover - especially in the summer as there is a ton of outdoor seating and covered seating. The candied bacon is a dreamy dessert like bacon if you're coming for brunch and well cornbread always works with bbq. After sitting next to the smoker, I went with the brisket hash. There was a ton of delicious potato and the brisket was very good. I enjoy spice, but found the regular, sweeter house made bbq better than the spicy bbq and I'd love to try a vinegar bbq there sometime. I am looking forward to coming back for dinner and experiencing the full menu

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Cornbread Candied Bacon Dinner
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

aBVrSubsi0pQkRaHNEULFA.text: Stop number three on our search for brunch today. We thought Walters was going to be the saving grace since they served brunch until 4 and were busy, so that seemed to be a good sign.   We were seated and the server brought carafe of water and a stack of empty plastic cups. We took two cups off the stack and immediately noticed there was a white sludge in one of the cups. It was disgusting.   This place is dirty. Won't be going back here.

FUMiS0IgOtKKlkNTaA5VyQ.text: Great BBQ, and terrific service. The brisket is delicious and authentically Southern. I received my order after just a couple minutes.   I do wonder why their December draft list has just one Porter, but their Pizza Boy was a pleasant consolation.   Everything came on paper plates, I suppose that's fine for take out, however I'd prefer real plates.   I know it's a BBQ, but it would be great to have vegetarian options. For example, the Double Wide has some of the best veggie food in the city.  Overall, a solid choice for BBQ.

Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. East End Blackstrap

HGdYyYHclyDXz4O6T-JU1A.text: Walter's a new BBQ joint in Lawrenceville. They are open year around - in the warmer months, there is an amazing outdoor patio that features outdoor seating and fun lawn games. In the colder months, they have heated tent and plenty of indoor seating.   I had emailed Joel the manager because I was planning a Pittsburgh foodie night and wanted to make sure there was plenty of room for us. We opted for a Tuesday night at 6pm - since they knew we were coming - they had reserved a table for us.   We started with some appetizers- we ordered the catfish sliders, cornbread, and queso and chips. The Walters team brought us some of their chili appetizer to try as well. I enjoyed all of the appetizers- perfect for sharing.   For my entree- I tried a 1/4 lb of the pulled pork, the Mac & cheese, and coleslaw. The pulled pork was delicious! I liked the Mac and cheese. I would try a different side next time than the coleslaw.   We also tried the brownie and waffle desserts. They were both very good.   In conclusion, I will definitely be back to Walter's again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

DxFd_B7a2mRs4Tc30xPhJA.text: Walters has a really cool outdoor atmosphere, with patio tables and games such as corn hole and jenga. Food is okay, drinks are okay - would not entirely recommend having a sit down meal here. Definitely stop by though for a drink on a nice day and play some games with friends!

6GbGBcWY8tQMTMRqiUH2JA.text: You get hungry as soon as you walk in! The smells are amazing. We ordered a little bit of everything. It was difficult to determine the difference between the fatty and the lean brisket. Therefore, go with the lean!! The sauces they offer are very different. I liked the sweet, my husband liked the spicy. They did run out of the beef ribs special which was unfortunate.   I wasn't a big fan of the cole slaw, but there are other veggie choices. It just seemed a little chemical tasting to me for some reason.  I took away a star as they only had sweet tea, no unsweetened. I hope they recycle as they use a lot of paper products. Service was good and the prices were fair.  We will definitely be back....soon in fact!!

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Boy does it smell good here!

F59xEA06waGlUtgFR_bd3g.text: Our family was all in the mood for barbecue so we got together here for dinner out. We heard good things about this place and that the food was really good but the service was very slow. And that is the Truest thing that I can say about it. Don't get me wrong the waitress was very attentive in bringing out our drinks and taking our order but delivering the food was another story. And I feel that was on the kitchen and not her. The best advice I can give you is to order your food immediately upon arriving along with the appetizers. Otherwise Sitting on those picnic tables for over an hour will just make you mean!

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

pjv7J2WSaKyMSJxFY7UIXA.text: Wasn't bad but wasn't amazing either.   * Food: We ordered 1/4lb brisket, 1/4lb pork ribs, slaw and fries. The pork ribs was a tad bit salty and the slaw was mediocre. However, the brisket and fries were pretty good and I would probably order those again if I came back here.   * Cost vs. Worth: The brisket and pork ribs come in 3 different portions (1/4lb, 1/2lb, 1lb). We got 1/4lb for both and it was $6.5 for the brisket and $5 for the pork ribs. If you like variety and want to try different food, the 1/4lb would be good for sharing with 2 people. The slaw and fries were $4 each. Overall, I think the meats are very reasonably priced. The slaw didn't taste good enough for me to spend $4 on it.   Will I come here again? - Probably not. I feel like there might be better places.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Fries, slaw, 1/4lb brisket, 1/4lb pork ribs

poXMyQ8EPFodCOesVx_4UQ.text: Went to Walters for dinner tonight after having walked past it so much. We'd heard the service wasn't great but figured we would give it a shot anyway. We were seated then had to wait 5-7 minutes before a waiter approached us. A little annoying but we had already figured out everything we wanted so we put our entire order in and waited. Our drinks were the last to come out, but my mango mojito was delicious! It didn't taste "fake fruity" and was super refreshing. We got the pork belly and brisket (lean) to split and both were top notch / so tender and flavorful. The chips and queso were on happy hour special and really good so I'd definitely recommend you get some. Even though the food was really good the service was discombobulated the entire evening and soured our experience so I'm not sure we will be back.

QDwC0uU-Yt13cjPj_ohdYg.text: I've been passing this place on Butler for months now wondering what it was going to be. When I heard it was going to be a bbq restaurant I was ecstatic! Pittsburgh is definitely lacking with good bbq so I'm glad we are finally starting to get more options.  I went for brunch on a fairly chilly fall day. I was a little surprised the entire place was open as if it was a nice summer day. I decided to get the breakfast burrito. It was definitely good but I expected it to have a little more bbq in it. It seemed like it was mostly just egg, beans, and sausage. Being that it's a bbq place I would have expected a lot more bbq itself.   I've heard from friends that the bbq is very good so I would definitely like to try it again for dinner some time. I look forward to seeing what they do with the space once it's winter.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

NPKVkWRGTzsYGHwP8Y3Vpg.text: I really want to like this place. The food is really good, the smells are amazing, the location is awesome. However, I can't get past the absolute horrible service that I've experienced several times from the same server who is usually there during the day.   No menus for ten mins despite being virtually the only customers in the place. No one knows the WiFi password, no one even knows the WiFi network. Servers adjusting paper towel rolls and adding silverware and full water bottles to empty tables - all while customers are waiting for water/drink refills and have no silverware of their own. Having to carry my own check to the register because no one ever bother coming back to the table. The server in this case, makes a lot of effort to be outwardly friendly but there is zero substance underneath it and you'll be lucky if she remembers you are in the restaurant once you've sat down.   Sorry guys - you are on to something here with this restaurant but you need to address your service and this server. The overall experience of arriving at the restaurant is confusing and no one seems to take responsibility for ensuring a good guest experience.

7oD_NuYinibhbJciGT3WMA.text: I gave Walter's a second chance and I'm glad I did. We went here at the beginning of the dinner rush. They were out of two minor things. Our server had a trainee with her, no biggie, both were very friendly. Once again though, the service wasn't great. We often went great lengths of time between visits to our table. I also don't like that they have room temperature water at the tables. The one highlight was the food, I had the pork sandwich and it was excellent. I tried both of the BBQ sauces at the table, both were fantastic. I also tried someone's mac and cheese and it was very good. The food definitely made the trip worth it but the service still was lacking. One last thing is the paper towels, the ones available at the table are really poor quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Pork Sandwich

21xslKK-_PZLlHWn5z4FrA.text: This is going to be a really great addition to Lawrenceville's patio scene next summer.   Stopped in for a drink last Thursday and while you can tell they have some things to works on, the drinks we ordered we great. Service is on par with a new space. They technically don't have a hostess area when you first arrive making is awkward to know what to do next. After looking around for a minute we were greeted by the hostess who helped us find a place on the grass patio.   I really love how big the outdoor seating area is. You won't find anything else like it on this side of he city. Lots of people were there with dogs or small children running around. They do have a few yard games available. I can see this being a really great space for a fall Sunday afternoon.  I'm anxious to go back to try the food. Really excited to see he full menu come out!

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

tHtx2cQF3pnFbjSlVm0tAA.text: We came here for a drink during the day, it was perfect. Cool bar area and tons of games. There's some porch swings you can chill on. Beer was cold. What more could you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. Outdoor seating

t5NkagnuW27AaG4fsYIcsw.text: Put a sign out front that states if it's grab a table or see a hostess. It's always different and confusing. Food is good though.

YUbwvjvKffqqk4CogbISLA.text: TL;DR - it was better land use as an abandoned car dealership. Good riddance to bad rubbish.  Alright. I waited until after my fourth visit to write a review, because, hey, I'm not unreasonable, and they haven't been open that long. So, give 'em a chance, right? Well, we thought the worst experiences at Walter's were behind us... until tonight.   We should've known better - all three of our experiences up until this point have been subpar (mostly entirely due to HORRIBLE service), but tonight, our waitress, while taking our order, answered her phone. Literally in the middle of taking our order. Like, there she was, chatting away on her phone. What? Then our food (only 1/4 of what we actually ordered) was delivered by a visibly intoxicated woman, and I had to actually take the tray from her, so she didn't drop it on my lap.   Then, when more than an hour went by and the rest of food we ordered NEVER appeared, we were told that they didn't actually have those items, and it was OUR fault. Wha? At which point, the waitperson sent over the manager for us to speak to, who was none other than... the intoxicated person. COOL. She blamed her waitstaff, the POS system, it being a Sunday night, but never apologized.   We waited another 30 minutes, at which point, the waitperson came back and just told us we could leave. Which was very strange. We left. And will never come back.   TL;DR - it was better land use as an abandoned car dealership. Good riddance to bad rubbish.

Aoi8a2hQpjkg5w-VEmxX8g.text: I stopped by here this past Tuesday night with my wife for dinner.  We had been excited about heading to Walters ever since we heard that it was a Southern Kitchen.  The fact that their outdoor space  looked pretty awesome too was a bonus although due to the cold on the night that we were there we didn't use it.  It was tented and probably warm but my wife and I walked into the restaurant and were told to seat ourselves.  So we grabbed some menus and headed over to a table.  The inside of this place is smaller than I thought it would be with a large rectangle bar dominating the middle of it and tables all around it.  There were a couple of TVs around the bar and then the walls looked  like they had been Demo'd down to the studs and found a cool wood wall behind it and kept it.  Whenever we were greeted by the waitress she informed us that they were out of turkey, pork belly and sausage that night.  Yes it was a random Tuesday night in the winter but that was almost half the meats.  For dinner on this day my wife and I decided to split our dinners and so she ordered the fried chicken dinner which came with Mac and cheese and collard greens.  Then I went with a 1/4 lb of brisket (lean), 1/4 lb of pulled pork and asked about getting a 4 oz portion of the Jamaican me crazy Mac and cheese.  I was told only the original came in the 4 oz portions and so I tried to order the 8 oz portion.  I was told that wasn't allowed either and that it came in a skillet and was a meal itself.  What was odd is that I didn't see any of this on the menu but still decided to order it after asking the price ($10).  After a fairly short wait our food arrived to the table and we dug in.  The first thing that I tried was the fried chicken which was fantastic.  The breading was on the thicker side but had a good flavor to it and the chicken inside was still moist.  After that I tried the original Mac and cheese which came with the meal and thought it was pretty dry.  The last part of that meal was the collards which were decent.  As for the food that I ordered I thought that the brisket was decent.  It had a well defined smoke ring and the rub on the outside was tasty but the meat itself was somewhat dry.  After that I went for the pulled pork which I thought was alright.  Last but certainly not least was the Jamaican me crazy Mac and cheese.  The menu describes it as  Mac and cheese with Scotch bonnet marinated chicken, grilled pineapple, toasted coconut.  It was surprisingly good and tasted like a Caribbean Jerk Mac and cheese.  Even the pineapple which I was initially dubious about worked as the sweetness helped to cut through the spice.  After dinner was over we were told that they had no desserts that evening and so the check was brought out to us.  The bottom line for me is that I might stop by here again in the future.  Walters has some really good items like the Jamaican Mac and cheese and the fried chicken.  However they were also out of more meats than you think they would be and some of their other dishes were dry or meh.

Me89CGrv2A01OUwrpTKCrw.text: Went on a Friday night and my opinion is that this place is just okay. Great, fun atmosphere that I probably would have enjoyed more in my 20's. Service was meh and the food was mixed - we got the fried chicken platter plus some pork belly and pulled pork. The fried chicken was the best part of the meal but honestly just made me yearn for Union Pig and Chicken (RIP). The mac and cheese was way too rich, collard greens were pretty good. Both varieties of the pork were just okay, but the bbq sauce is too sweet for my liking. Happy hour ends at 6 which seems ridiculously early for those who work standard hours. Also they charge $2 for a glass of soda water which is a total ripoff. Overall - would probably come back if some friends wanted to, but wouldn't be my choice if I were the one making the decision.

gzE0AcIprBhIHzAtvbwmEw.text: Stopped in today for brunch. The space is really cool - would be a good place for large groups/party.  We came right when they opened and didn't have trouble getting a table for 6, but it ended up getting really crowded.   They have about eight options for their brunch menu, plus they offer a few bbq option from their regular menu during brunch hours. I ended up ordering the avocado toast with eggs. Overall it was pretty good, but was a little disappointed at the size of toast and amount of avocado. Their only side during brunch are home fries.

ukN5hn-ZThPgJEBMt-XKaw.text: Stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon towards the end of the brunch rush, just to check it out and grab a drink.   Menu - limited, but food is pretty different/seems solid. When we went, only a select few items plus their regular brunch items were available. We ordered the $4 candied bacon for a snack, which was very good (but sticky, had to wash hands afterwards). Their draft list also seemed kind of limited (for what I expected for an outdoor bar area) but they had an excellent blueberry sour I tried, and they also have white claws for anyone looking for a lighter option.   Atmosphere - pretty awesome. The bar and a few tables are shaded in the area when you first walk in, then to the left of the entry walkway there's an area with tables (some shaded, but most not shaded) as well as a corn hole and ping pong area. Pretty cool outdoor place to come hang out with a group of friends on a weekend if the weathers nice (just make sure to wear sunscreen, because the shaded areas are pretty limited). They did have fans running which was nice, but still didn't help much with the scorching sun. They also have a few games like jenga and connect four in addition to the larger ones!   Service - pretty good. Only downside honestly is the conundrum of if you want to order food/drink from a waitress, you're kind of stuck at that table until you close out. That was fine for us, but could see us just trying to get a drink at the bar next time and then taking it over to the game area.   Parking - they do have their own lot, but it's pretty small/limited (maybe 10 spots?) so I wouldn't rely on that. There's also a ton of street pay parking in the area.   TLDR - pretty awesome atmosphere, just kind of a struggle on a really hot/sunny day due to lack of shaded options. If they were able to get some umbrellas for their non-shaded picnic tables/for the corn hole area, I think that could be a game changer.

BXcSseBEU--8E4b4QGW3vA.text: I like that they have games by the front, they have connect four and corn-hole and ping pong.  And I like the porch swings and the relaxed New Orleans feel.  And like the hanging lights.  But I don't plan on going back.  Very, very small portions for the price.  With the tip included it was over $60 for the two of us and as we were leaving we both said we were still hungry, because it was just very little food for the price.  And it felt like the waitress (Ceidra K) was annoyed with us, like my girlfriend ordered an alcoholic drink and needed to get her ID out of her purse, and apparently the 10 seconds it took to do that was too long for the waitress, because she just walked away from the table while taking our order.  And the waitress was standing like 6 feet away from out table while taking the order, and she kept having us repeat everything we said, maybe if she stood closer to the table she could hear us.  And we asked for lemon with our water 3 times.  And never got any lemon.  And the food is served in like paper plates with super cheap plastic cups.  And I get it, it's meant to match the feel of the place like meant to feel like New Orleans style.  But for the prices they charged, I feel ripped off getting served with paper plates.

JtK6pbWVqvTsr07u8TcBTg.text: This is a fantastic place to hang out with large groups of friend's. We had amazing service (10/10) and the beer selection was top notch (something for everyone).  Things I liked: - Once again I thought our service was amazing! - the collard greens and mac and cheese were on point. Although I prefer a slightly sweeter collard green vs. the more acidic kind I had, I think it balanced out the heaviness of the meats quite well. The mac and cheese was topped with bread crumbs and added a crunchy texture to the ooey gooey deliciousness of the mac and cheese. - Brisket is tender and fatty, everything you could want. However, I thought the seasoning could be improved (I thought it was A-okay, but not amazing). - Sauces were a must, they were amazing! - Pulled pork is also super tender, again seasoning was A-okay..  Things I didn't like - I ordered a fried chicken platter, and I was a bit disappointed with the chicken. When I think of southern comfort food, fried chicken should be a bit greasy, the chicken a bit fatty, and the breading a bit oily. Instead, I got something that was a bit too "perfect" - the chicken breast was super lean, the breading not oily or that flavorful, and overall I didn't get that sense of comfort when eating heavy, salty, comfort food.  - The cornbread was a bit too cakey for my liking: I think cornbread is best when it's a bit gritty and crumbly.

GIhX04PGZe2UxkHBvFrObA.text: 5 for atmosphere for sure. This is like going to a cool outdoor party at your college friends backyard. There is fun for all ages and it's dog friendly. It can get pretty hot though so be prepared with your attire and sunscreen if you're not into awkward tan lines.  3.5 for service. It was okay. The place was pretty busy and it ran just fine.  Pretty average. I didn't encounter the same issues that others did before me. I definitely saw some people going directly to the draft beers and pouring them out only to then see them drinking themselves. No one looked intoxicated and I might do the same if I worked there on a weekend. Staff was friendly enough. There were two bartenders. One pretty obviously ignored us and the other seemed like he was doing his best to get to everyone on my side.  3 for food and Drink: they have a Prosecco based cocktail on the menu but they had run out of Prosecco. They also ran out of the next two drinks I asked for so I ended up getting one of the draft beers they had not yet run out of. It was cold enough for a hot day. Just a bit annoyed. The brunch menu is okay too. I ordered the burrito and it's a hefty portion served with a side salad. The burrito was really good and hearty. The side salad was not so good. There was something weird about the greens. They were not light and crisp and I really couldn't taste any dressing so I passed on the grass.  My husband ordered the steel mill brisket breakfast. The brisket was pretty good.  All in all this place is probably a three and it's a solid average option for food. BUT if you want to have a chill outing with whatever drinks they happen to actually stock that day then it's worth the trip. Especially if you have a pup! I'll be back to try dinner and check out the crowd then. It was definitely very busy when I went for brunch and seems to be decently popular.

yrwjyCJX6Y_pYjfF1lG0pA.text: I am not quite sure if was the weather, the crowd, the atmosphere or the service and food itself, but this a frickin' great spot. sx-vRCvjYvRx4U4lQpb-rw.text: Service here was really, really awful. 15 minutes to get our drink order.  One item showed up, the other beverage didn't show up until 20 minutes later after after reminding our not-so-friendly waitress twice. We were there on a Saturday and you can only order brunch and some appetizers until 4:00 pm, which was disappointing.  The chicken and waffles was good, not great.  Minuscule amount of syrup provided to accompany the meal and our waitress never brought any additional.  Had to request water 3x before it showed up and getting a refill was an act of futility.  Never checked on our drinks or asked if we'd like another.  I'd really like to try the bbq meats here, because what they were bringing out of the smoker looked great.  There are a number of review that mention the poor service, but nothing being done.  No managers to be found

KJ8Cc_ltZMHnzybzdO-JzQ.text: Me, my daughter Muff, my sister Luch and my best friend just went to the Pittsburgh Home & Garden show.  Afterwards, we always go somewhere to eat after walking all through the Convention Center. This year, we decided to go to Walter's BBQ Southern Kitchen.  We got there right before closing and I was excited because I've been wanting to go there for a while.  Walter's looks like a "pseudo" honkytonk place.  Wooden tables, Styrofoam containers, etc... The wait staff is dressed very casually and they were actually quite knowledgeable about the menu options.  Since all of us were starving, we ordered quite a bit of the menu.  My best friend ordered the Smoked Wings ($7/$13 - 6 or 12) Naked, Buffalo, of BBQ) and Collard Greens ($4.00), my daughter Muff ordered a 14 pound of the beef brisket and a side order of the Mac-n-Cheese, my sister Luch ordered their Chicken and Waffles and I ordered the $13 Double Stacked Burger  1/2lb of organic beef, topped with American cheese, pork belly and Walters special sauce with a side of the Mac-n-Cheese.  My sister thoroughly enjoyed her waffles and found them to have a texture and consistency that was really flavorful.  With regards to her chicken, she liked the portion size but noticed that the breading kept falling off of the chicken.  She found the flavor of the chicken to be okay...nothing bad, but nothing outstanding.  My best friend's wings had the requisite smoky taste, however, they weren't cooked all the way through and the taste of her collard greens was just okay.    Now about my burger...I have to say that my burger was absolutely delicious.  You can't go wrong with high-grade ground beef, slabs of smoked pork belly and melted American cheese.  Mmm Mmm good!  My daughter was equally pleased with her smoked beef brisket.  She said it was tender and juicy and melted in her mouth.  Where we part ways is on the mac-n-cheese.  I didn't find the mac-n-cheese to be all that flavorful.  It was barely average, in my opinion.  However, my daughter loved it.  She didn't mind adding salt and pepper to her serving.  I don't want to have to do that and still end up with average mac-n-cheese.  Overall, I just have to say that Walter's was a little hit and miss.  I was excited to go there, but it didn't quite live up to the hype.  I think that they need to go talk to a southern Nana and ask for a couple of her recipes for the side dishes.  Plus, they ran out of to-go containers and we had to wrap our leftovers in aluminum foil.    I'll go back again and see how things pan out.  Maybe we hit them during an off night.

P9Y2SI0Lon88040K_H1a6A.text: First off, the food was very, very good. They do a great job of the smoking and grilling meats. And the menu is very creative too! The outdoor atmosphere a definite plus likewise.  I wish Walter's would dispense with the idea of waitstaff for the tables. Now that I see other reviews, it doesn't look like I'm alone. Even on a Sunday morning where half the place still had open seating, service was slow and anything but attentive. Two of our four entrees were initially dropped off, then about 5 minutes later, the third one was dropped off, but it was the wrong entree, but of course no chance to point that out till the fourth entree was dropped off...that gave a chance to mention to the waiter that the 3rd entree was wrong and of course another wait until the correct one was delivered. To the management, why not dispense with the idea of having untrained, unsupervised waitstaff, and just have an order window where after placing your order you return to pickup your order and carry it to the table yourself? Same could be done with the drinks too.  How can so many comments about the service go unaddressed for so long???? I guess if you're making money in spite of it all, it doesn't matter??? You have a great quality product with your food, so with the service, why not either fix it or forget it?

hie-Igvyzo8CVSzoLbBS3w.text: Update to the update time! MOST IMPORTANT: ONLY GO FOR A 5PM DINNER OR FOR BEER. Do Not Go at normal dining hours for dinner.    Walters is back down to 3 stars, rounding up; and that's being generous. Reasons? Here they are.    1) They charge $4.50 for Yuengling.  Yeah, you read that right. Might as well be a BYOB for the beer prices they charge (tap beers are $6.50-$8 or $9).  2) I realize restaurants like Walters cannot predict people just parking their butts at tables and not leaving, but, still, provide customers who are coming for dinner at a normal dining hour an update. I know, in this day and age, that sounds entitled, but it's kind of courtesy.  Something just like "Hey, it's gonna be a longer wait, sorry about that." We showed up tonight, as a total group of 5 (a friend was in toen visiting and wanted to check out Walters) and were told, upon getting to Walters at 7, that it'd be an hour only wait; that's not bad. Fast forward to 8:30. There was no text message, multiple tables had been moved around and marked as reserved and when we went up to ask, we were told it'd be another hour!   We left and got food down the street.  As we place our food order there, our group got the text from Walters that our table was ready.  Too little too late!  Like i said, i get that in the restaurant business you can't control how long people stay, especially at a hopping and social place like Walters, But if you're gonna be at capacity at 7pm on a Saturday and exist in Lawrenceville, you're clearly too ambitious for your britches.  3) Walters tonight felt less like a BBQ restaurant and more like your high-end brewpub that happened to serve BBQ. It was bro-central tonight, on top of that.    Walters is where you go with friends for drinks after dinner, or maybe a 5pm dinner right when they open. That's it.   Be better Walters, be better.  We're not gonna be back.

o-8eNxpEjbJf77V_HMKDhA.text: So I went back to Walter's....  THIS year they added a tent outside and made it into an outdoor lounge with lounge seating and added a long bar table.   The menu was the same and they had most food except their brunch.   Being warm out it was extremely crowded and it took over an hour to get seated. It was filled with college, frat and locals dressed in their sexy summer clothes.   I ordered the corn bread and chicken and waffles. I expected to get homemade food.... but I was wrong....  My cornbread was ok but a little dry. It did come with some cream for dipping which made a difference.  THEN I got my chicken and waffles. The waffles were good and homemade. The chicken was another story. I thought I would get a nice piece of southern fried chicken. Instead I got a frozen chicken cutlet with some sprinkled on breading that was as dry as bone! I gagged all the way to the end of this dinner. While eating, the neighbor's dog was sniffing me and trying to eat my fork!  I don't understand why they are serving frozen food when the catch is that they are making homemade southern food in a barbecue pit?  I needed a breather so I went and sat on the side where they have a garden. Whilst sitting there some drunk kid and his girlfriend walked up to me and accused me of stealing their phone. Later...  they found it at the hostess stand...   The food here is always hit or miss. The venue is a cool place to hang out for the summer as long as you don't get beat up.

oV_oIGmy3r8Zr4xnhrr77Q.text: Super long wait, music was way too loud and a terrible DJ playing it. Service was slow, and half our table did not get food until after paying the split bill. We arrived at the same time. High prices for what you get, 50 bucks for six slices of brisket, too salty mac and cheese and two beers. Had to grab our own silverware and cut my finger on the bottom of the chair while pulling it in closer to the table. They must have been thrown away from a school at some point. Glad I got that tetanus shot a few years ago!  The meat itself is acceptable, but hopefully it improves with time. I got a lot of fat on my small portion (supposedly half pound) of brisket. Pittsburgh is a tough city to find good BBQ, but Walter's is low on my list.  I have to give anyone credit for attempting to make BBQ, it can be tough to get right. I'd say work on the basic sides then give it more value, soul, and southern hospitality. It's nice to have a big plate of meat and sides per typical BBQ joint. Not really into clubbing while being served "small plates" for BBQ. Hope to try again in the future when the growing pains are sorted out.

FJZL2zSaud1vJ5k2dpUI2Q.text: Place is 'ok' at best when it comes to bbq. We went for Sunday brunch, which was disappointing to find out that the only available bbq was the brisket...at a bbq joint. Anyways, the brisket is so covered in rub which is a bit spicy, you can't tell if the actual meat is decent or not.  It's also very pricey for sub par food. Service is disjointed. Probably will never go again.

lDuaA47ZfdJd-cIndHGA6A.text: GREAT new place to enjoy well prepared food with a touch of Bronx, NY added for spice. The owners really spent some time creating a beautiful and fun ambiance mixed with just enough class to make this a one of a kind bar in Pittsburgh.

lJOiOLWBBqJzOWFuPyPfBg.text: I went to Walters for the 3rd time tonight and must say my experience was quite disappointing. My boyfriend and I got there around 7pm. The outside and inside seating we're both full so we put our names in for a table and went to the bar. We got a drink and waited for our table. They weren't very busy and I noticed they were seating everyone who came in after us but we never got the phone call our table was ready. Eventually we finally went to the bar to close out our tab. While at the bar I noticed the hostess who took my name down was talking with her friends at the bar and not paying attention to anything going on. We eventually went up to a waitress and asked what the wait time was. They clearly were annoyed with the hostess and seated us right away. Our waitress was very nice but I do feel like the food didn't wow me like it did the first time. I'll go again because of the convenience of living close but it is disappointing. They have been open over a month now so you would think their service problems would be figured out by now

ymaFQLmzuvBv9O3hlwwT_w.text: Terrible. Everybody around us is not getting their food. I finished my meal before my date received hers. Pathetic excuse for a restaraunt. Had the time to download this app and post this review it was so bad.

sWJ83YN3sYUNLwsJJr12Zw.text: I would recommend Walter's to anybody passing through Pittsburgh. Amazing brisket, fun environment and wonderful staff. Such a nice surprise to find authentic BBQ on our visit.

JDjM4qctZy3wkFv2MWTkUg.text: The food was awesome! Brisket was so tender and juicy, bbq sauce had a low heat, collard greens had a good bite to them, all around we were really happy with the food. Service was a little slow to come to us, but food was fast to come out. They did run out of ribs, chicken and Mac and cheese which is why we only gave them the 4 stars.

UDrsoVSJh6ho8EODI5riEQ.text: Great food. The food was delicious and the chicken was so moist. The candied bacon was my favorite. Love the atmosphere great hang out spot.

p5XpnHvtCkXeFgbnkTTTcw.text: One of the best experiences I've had dining out. The food was absolutely incredible and the atmosphere was upbeat and welcoming. If you are patient and in for a good time this is the place. The owners are there 24/7...their hospitality on display 110%. Thank you for making our experience one of the best yet. Will be back again... and again.Welcome to Pittsburgh Walters.

nHWH4EQbc9xXysCcU9yjzA.text: The beer selection on draft was great! Mostly local breweries, whick I love in a restaurant. The turkey and brisket were amazing! The service needs some work. Orders came out wrong, but they did make it right. The wings were also very good. Will definitely be back.

QcM91bxs8MN-LpQU19Q4mA.text: Outstanding food and service! Texas bbq done the right way. Stop by you won't be disappointed!

4ejA367FB_iaPtPbmBYfCg.text: I was so excited to try this place, and couldn't have been more disappointed. We arrived around 3:00pm on a Friday and they were out of almost everything we wanted, including tacos (how are you out of ALL tacos?), cornbread, brisket, and pulled pork. My husband ended up having some chicken and I had a side of collard greens. Both were okay - not spectacular but not horrible. We left hungry and went across the street to Bahn Mi & Ti (where people were SO friendly and the food was good - I'll be writing a separate positive review for this place).  The indoor seating at Walter's is minimal, so I'm not sure what they're going to do in the winter. We sat outdoors, where the silverware (which consisted of one fork - huh?) sits in a container on the table and where the flies and bees buzz in the air around you. I guess you risk dealing with bugs when sitting outside, but the bees really inconvenienced myself and a diner at another table. I almost knocked over a server with a tray full of food while doing one of my "run away from the bees" dances. Overall, there was not a single positive thing about Walter's and I can't recommend them. I should have listened to the other negative reviews. . .

7xSgv9CWFnv-GFIkjmwmsA.text: !!!Brunch 11am-4pm!!! After a night of heavy drinking, I came in on a Sunday more hungover than than a sorority girl on January 1st after going to a Justin Bieber concert on NYE. And let me tell you, that brunch gave me life. Brisket hash and eggs, highly recommended.  Overall the menu easy and everything is smoked right outside.

NcxHIj9tRTVt_nlP7nrx7g.text: The best barbeque ever period! We went twice, first for dinner and the next day for the brunch. We enjoyed ordering various meats and sides for our table at dinner. Particularly good was the barbecue chicken and turkey. The collard greens were excellent as was the mac and cheese. The branches were excellent and included hash that was homemade barbecued meat. The breakfast burrito was outstanding. Everything was very very fresh. Particularly good with that breakfast burrito was the collard green fresh salad with a sweet peanut dressing.

JIuudKENcYX5szBjayPviA.text: BEST BEST BEST brisket sandwich ever!!! after tasting the first bite and feeling an explosion of flavors in every taste bud plus the perfect texture of the meat: SOFT AND DELICIOUS!!... now I can be sure that god exists. Thanks Walter! Or whoever created this amazing receipt

H_JfdJzv7ux4gzuJBQUVEw.text: I was underwhelmed. The service was pretty terrible, the waitress seemed not to care about us at all the first time I visited. The atmosphere is great and the food was decent so I decided to try again. I was let down even more by the service the second time. The waitress (a different one) again seemed uninterested and after roughly 10 minutes of waiting for a menu, picking a beer, and finally ordering, we were informed that the drafts were all down. We left without ordering anything else.

88_IYtwME77VaXvj5Mag-w.text: Awesome and beautiful place! My man and I both got the brisket, and he got fries and I got mashed potatoes. It was all delicious. It was a beautiful day, and there were dogs everywhere haha. Definitely going back for another nice evening

Dg5LGAIBK-YVz14p0aofcQ.text: We were very excited to try this place but it was very dissapointing. Unfortunately we can't review the food because we never got any. We arrived at 1pm on Saturday and discovered that they only serve brunch from 11-4 and dinner from 5 to "sold out."  Who eats brunch all day and would that mean no food from 4-5? They have a lunch menu which is posted on line but nothing was mentioned on their site about lunch only being served during the week. In addition to that it took quite some time before the server came to our table. The place was not busy. The nail in the coffin was when the server tried to convince us that many of the brunch items were really "dinner food." Went to North Park Lounge and had great food and excellent service.

CYUaiM_uXOvDHPyilueqCA.text: We came here for my wife's birthday with a larger group of people on a Thursday night. We really appreciated being able to grab a table for 10 right away, and the service was speedy. They also happily accommodated splitting the check multiple ways, which was awesome of our server. The brisket and pulled pork were both delicious, as were the buffalo wings! The beer selection is good, though they were out of several drafts, which seemed kind of strange, and it's on the expensive side for Pittsburgh ($8!). The sides we're generally underwhelming, and there weren't a lot of vegetable options (no green beans or okra!). Prices are high, especially considering that you order a la carte, and there isn't a dinner plate option. Speaking of plates, the presentation was very casual, given the prices. If we were in a southern city all of this would warant a poor review, but Walter's is still the best BBQ we've had in Pittsburgh!

1xarEsxu89t4mvnrCCZDaw.text: First time at Walter's and we got plain wings, pork belly, pork ribs, potato salad and mac n cheese. The meats were seasoned just right and didn't need any sauce, but their sauces are good so, win win. Mac n cheese had a crunchy crumb crust and wasn't overly wet or gloopy. Potato salad was southern style but with some zing and extra vegetables thrown in for crunch. Wings were fine, fried just right and decent size. We got only six and they were all drummies, not sure if that was by design. Good beer selection.

pr0oQegJFxbLQ8k_6YbE9w.text: Stopped for lunch, should have known it was only brunch (it is lawrenceville you know. Got there right after it opened , staff was very nice and very attentive at first when I ordered a beer (8 bucks) crazy for an east end porter. Anyways the server says out of the lost of 10 things listed on the menu for lunch only 3 things were available so right there I knew we were in for a weird time. Only thing they had was breakfast burrito , chicken and waffle, avocado toast ( imagine that ). We ordered the breakfast burrito which did turn out to be very tasty except for the side salad of straight up raw greens and some dressing. One bite and I had to spit it out. Chicken and waffles were ok. Waffle was very good , chicken was dry dry dry . Oh also they did have wings so I got 6 . Came out no smoke taste and the most rubbery wings I've ever had.(7 dollars for 6 of them). So 40 dollars for 2 entrees and a beer , not a cup of coffee to be found and once we got our food our server must have left the county. Everyone else enjoy, I know hundreds of other places so much better.

JnWEiHUx7n7dttQDSY40Xg.text: We went on a Friday night and the place was PACKED! I knew when I saw this place being built that it would be popular as it's in a very central location in Lawrenceville and offers a great outdoor area.  We sat at the bar because there was a 30-45 minute wait for a table. The inside is small with about 10 tables. Plenty of seating outside but I don't see how seating will work when winter hits.  One bartender (blonde bob) was rude when we were attempting to order drinks. We paused and she was like "oh not ready" and walked away. Luckily another very nice bartender waited on us.  The food was SLOW but like I said the place was PACKED! The bartender gave us a complimentary drink for our wait which we appreciated!  We ordered the smoked chicken wings with BBQ sauce and they were very good. I had the Bad Arse Chicken Sandwich sandwich and it was delicious...messy but good. The fries that came with it also we good.  I gave this place a 4 star review because the food was good and I feel like they have so much potential. Food was slow but I enjoyed myself and would return.

xqDaYXtSc1x_zbd2fx5NeQ.text: The wait for food is absurd.... it took over an hour to get the food. The people sitting next to us actually left because it was so long. The waiter said "all food is made to order, so it takes awhile"... for the prices I'm paying I would expect it would be made to order, and should never take this long.

L-IVvE_bTm7Hn-wap4ykpA.text: My 4 star rating is mostly based on the great atmosphere. The food was decent but small portions. Service was good but they were out of multiple things on the menu.

G6XPXelXIiCagNfeAEQ1wA.text: If you are looking for a relaxing atmosphere I strongly suggest Walter's.  The food is great, the drinks are great....but the best thing is the feeling that you are at home, hanging out with family and friends. Also super dog friendly----for those of us who love our dogs or any dog this is immensely important. I highly recommend a trip here to check it out.

99w7Ky0X5o3peZFR0EK-4w.text: Ok BBQ in the heart of Lawrenceville. We went for lunch, so it wasn't busy at all. We were even able to find parking in their very small lot. Don't bet on that if you go for dinner. We had the small order of ribs, small order of pork belly, small mac and cheese, small potato salad and a piece of corn bread. The ribs and pork belly were good. The mac and cheese was decent, and the potato salad was sub par. I didn't care for the corn bread at all. It had an odd grassy sort of smell to it. They have two different BBQ sauces on the table. One didn't have a label, and I didn't care for it at all, and I really have never tried a BBQ I didn't like. The other sauce was sweet an spicy and was decent. Our server was minimally attentive, and none of the other workers there gave us the time of day even though it was a seat yourself place with no signage to tell you that. When we asked, a worker rolled her eyes and nodded yes we should seat ourselves. All in all, the meal was below average and I doubt we would return

_1BjWWOz76X_RpCNf-1X-Q.text: The fatty brisket is effing awesome.  The collards are ok to good. (Considering it is outside of the south, about as good as I could expect). The Mac is pretty good.  The service and atmosphere is wonky.  The menu was about half not available.  The beer menu lists breweries, but not beers, which is super annoying if you actually care to enjoy what you are drinking.  (The beer I ordered, a hazy ipa, was good but surprising that it cost $8.56) Overall I give it a meh, but if they can figure out how to bring everything else up to the level of the fatty brisket, they've got potential.

5VtKepoqr2Ya3Dj66rHs_g.text: We had a miserable experience here when it comes to service. Before I start complaining, I have to say that the hostess was beyond lovely. She made sure to let us know we were almost seated with multiple updates. When we were sat and didn't have a waitress for 10 minutes, we told her and she was on it! Our waitress, however, was not great. One of the people I was dining with ordered something and the waitress told her about 15 minutes later that they were out of that item. In any other circumstance, EVERY waiter/waitress I've ever had told us immediately if something was not available anymore. The same waitress also forgot about my drink and when I asked her about 15 minutes later, I saw her rush over and have the bartender make my drink. To top it off, the bill was incorrect as she had charged us for more than we ordered. I can't tell if she didn't care, or just wasn't paying attention, but overall it was a terrible experience dealing with her. I will say, again, the hostess was outstanding and everyone else we dealt with was excellent. If you go, make sure you know who you're getting or else you'll be writing a yelp review in your uber on your way to your house at 11pm.

x4144THt_vE--FKBvfzdSA.text: Don't expect any kind of customer service here. It's the Wild West. You have to fight for a seat. Never got to try the food. Not worth the effort in my opinion. If you go good luck. I'm definitely not coming back.

8Ns6QCSje3dISW0hseyImw.text: I appreciate Walters is new and I appreciate it is Saturday night but .... Wanted to try Walter's ribs but I assumed they would be busy and opted for take out.  Called twice to verify that they did have takeout.  No answer.  Walked to Walter's and waited in line for 10 minutes to ask the gentleman taking reservations if they do takeout.  He said they did and he would find a server to take my order.  Five to ten minutes later the server came.  She said they did takeout and handed me the (regular) menu.  Asked her how long it would take for an order of ribs and she told me 30 to 40 minutes.  For takeout??  So I can't speak to the quality of the food or table service but don't plan on takeout at Walters.

ttkScXul87Z94U2o4AnIsA.text: Was in Pittsburgh for work and stumbled upon Walter's. It was awesome. Everything was delicious.  The candied bacon is addictive.  Most of all I loved the vibe and setting. If I was a local, this would be my go to spot. I'll be very much looking forward to my next business trip so I can go back to Walter's!

-C2_8IwkdddzmfdPW5LQNw.text: This place is a real bummer. The first time I went, my order was incorrect and it was lukewarm. I chalked it up to new business working the kinks out. The second time I went, I waited 26 minutes for service after asking the host for help. This was on a Wednesday. I left. Someone convinced me to try it one more time. The service improved but the beer and food did not. Our draughts were warm and tasted off like they had been mixed with a cheap domestic( We ordered the Bronx built for this, Cigar City Jai Lai, and Pizza boy Hazelton native. The food once again was not hot. I hope y' all improve but I'll stick to the decent Bar-b-que joints in Homewood.

NwwsHUoQN7wwaz6-X8vy0Q.text: I'd like to think I know a thing or two about BBQ. I had the pleasure to visit Walter's on the soft opening weekend. This place is bursting with potential and you can tell it's more than hype. I've since been back. Wicked brisket and a distinct attitude. Have you seen the damn smoker? Whoever this Walter guy is, I want to meet him.  To anyone who complained about them running out of food during soft launch: Get a time machine and show up earlier, because it was worth it. Or just come back now. They are clearly getting up to speed in a hurry and are going to be a big deal.

kWYmgZRVLtGathyy7g-O9w.text: I've been twice so far and have cleaned my plate both times. The first visit was a few weeks after they had opened in summer 2018 and the second being in late February. While there were menu issues when they opened (most of the menu was unavailable) my husband and I ordered fatty brisket, ribs, Mac and cheese, cornbread and queso. Go big or go home. Brisket is mouth-watering and something I would always recommend. The other sides I enjoyed but the Mac and cheese was just too bland for my liking. It might be better as a base for a meal that I see they now offer.  The second visit I had the Bad Arse Fried Chicken sandwich and I said I wouldn't eat the entire thing. But I did. The breading was seasoned and had a nice bit of crunch to it. I ordered fries as my side and tried some of my husband's potato salad and it was great as well. It's more of a mustard based potato salad with I personally love.

fIEpEBDjY-fTgeZDz9mryA.text: Cool concept marred by indifferent service and really skimpy portions of brisket. Flavor is decent and meats are smoked on site, but after back to back underwhelming visits I'm done. Visit 1: My "brisket" breakfast burrito had 2 tiny bites of brisket in it - allll eggs. Waitress forgot my drink for 20 minutes and never checked on us. Visit 2: bartender pushed the brisket sandwich as the "always go to" but it was more bread and coleslaw than meat - maybe an 1/8 of a cup... Once again, never checked in till long after I was done. Trying too hard to be cool and not hard enough on their product.

jY3dn8iAOpYsUR2cb9Jv-A.text: I'm giving 5 stars for great fatty brisket and pork belly. 3- 4 stars for waiting service and two stars for bartender. He didn't know how to make Manhattan, one of most basic cocktails. He made it without bitters and orange peel, with cheap cherry juice and  bored attitude. Still the food won me and I'm planning to come back soon.

Wjd-dTc9sZZ0UhWGd13Wvg.text: Went to this restaurant after having some bad experiences at some of the other BBQ places in the area in hopes that it would give us a better, more delicious experience.  The food at this restaurant was TOP NOTCH. My mom and I split portions of the brisket and the pulled pork. Both were amazing! We also had coleslaw, corn bread, and the mac & cheese. I was trying to save some of the food to take home for leftovers, but it was so good that I left with a full, happy belly. I was ready to go back again the next night for more.  The only (minor) suggestion would be to have a more detailed beer list. I wanted a lighter ale, but wanted to try something that wasn't Miller Lite. I couldn't figure out by the list which one would be suitable, and my waitress was also unsure of which one to recommend.

PU8x8rWFdefFxr1-2zbMnw.text: What's not to like about tasty barbecue on a sunny day? Well, plenty when it comes to Walters. The brisket sandwich is a solid 5 on a 1-10 scale. Tasty sauce, but semi stale roll, and minimal meat action. This place will still crush it in the summertime because of their outdoor game setup and Lawrenceville location, but winters are probably going to be rough for them if they don't pick up their food game. I'd come here to drink beer and people watch, but probably not to eat again.

FFyO-KyLd_Ug4ApY6JVhkw.text: I really wanted to like this place, I did.  I've been here three times now and it has been disappointing every time.  They've been out of numerous items on the menu each time, service is okay at best and drinks are over priced.  The last time I was there, there was a group of six of us and all of our meals came out super cold and they would not separate our checks.  The only reason I'm giving two stars is because it's dog friendly.

FmAc0yvpIgHQCW4nbPmtDg.text: First time at Walter's on a Wednesday night, it was alright. They ran out of brisket (which was the reason why we came). The cornbread was really good and the smoked wings were decent. The smoky flavor wasn't all there, I've definitely had better.  Willing to give it a second try though!

rKPPOLTf2b03avd9H2ezfw.text: I went back and forth between 2 and 3 stars.   We came here once at the soft opening and per any soft opening there are going to be hiccups. Despite running out of many items, the food we got was all quite delicious (pork, ribs, brisket, Mac n cheese, collard greens). A group of us even took a pen to the menu and circled all the typo errors in attempt to provide feedback prior to the grand opening.  We returned a few weeks later having high hopes they had hit their groove. Our food was cold and they had run out of several things on the menu (we were there at noon). The best way I can describe the issues we encountered is there has to be a management problem.   Suggestions to Walters: 1. Fix the spelling errors. (See pictures). In Pittsburgh you can't spell Steelers, "steal"ers. 2. Change the brunch menu. You pride yourself on bbq but there is very little offered til 4pm on Saturday's and Sunday's. Disappointing. 3. Inventory. Both times we've been back southern staples such as cornbread and various meats have not been available.  Please note, the staff is super friendly and I think there is a lot of potential here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. &#34;Peacan&#34; pie.
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. This one always stands out to me. Desert vs dessert
Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States. spicy or &#34;Spicey&#34;?

Lal-8--XOavTwz2BrJPd1A.text: Visited late on a Wednesday. Interior very noisy so we went outside. A couple of other tables seated. As we feared, the waitress seemed to forget about us. Nonetheless we persevered. Ordered brisket, ribs, greens and Mac cheese. All were good. Not sure what's up w the MASH tent in front. Blocks the view of the street and generally odd

wsfPOhjmUWIvfFY8Dhw2_w.text: I liked everything about my visit to Walter's!  Our server was courteous, the drinks were on point, and the food... Oh - my - goodness!  I got the smoked wings as an appetizer.  For my meal, I got the fried chicken meal with greens and macaroni & cheese.  This restaurant is about 45 minutes from me, but it is well worth the trip!  I can't wait to go back and I'm bringing more people with me so they can experience this good food!

duZyS6_zoCU8cJ6bJoVOGg.text: So I was excited and hopeful about going to this new place, but our visit was extremely disappointing.  To begin with their beer selection is good, but their wine selection is not. When you are in an extremely popular area like Lawrenceville, you have to have everything at hand, but the did not.  My co-workers requested a Merlot and a Pinot Grigio, which they had neither. They we asked we asked for a tequila and tonic and they had no tonic. Again a huge mistake by a popular bar in the area. Upon ordering our lunches, we were informed they had no smoked  barbacue half chicken, isn't this a barbecue restaurant????  We did order other items off the menu which were good, but not outstanding, which is what we expected out of a restaurant in a prime location.   We hope things get better, but they definitely need help in quite a few areas.

cLSyGq2HjZTDpqj-J2-DcQ.text: I don't think I'll be coming back.   I tried Walter's opening weekend and they were out of pretty much everything but service was pretty good so I figured I'd give them benefit of the doubt and go back.   My friends and I sat in the tented area which was cozy enough. Immediately though, the waitress had the worst attitude. She acted as though we were an annoyance to her the minute she walked over. Funny enough, she stood over all of our shoulders and watched us tip her too. She deserved less than we all gave her but we felt so uncomfortable.   The first time visiting, everything was really dry like it had been sitting out or something. Mac and cheese, chicken, and fries. This time, I didn't like the brisket sandwich at all. The taste just wasn't right. The bread was awesome, queso wasn't bad, but I was really disappointed. Drinks also took a solid 30 minutes and there wasn't even a wait.    Overall, I feel like the concept of this place is awesome, especially in the summer. Execution leaves a lot to be desired.

34hheK0tfgSCkSWq2X9uRg.text: Our niece brought us here since she works in the area.  The atmosphere is open.  The service was mediocre.  The place was not busy and I had to go get the barbecue sauces and the paper towels used for napkins from the inside bar tender.  The barbecue was delicious.  We had a pork sandwich, a chopped sandwich, a mixed green salad with children and their classic Mac.

loe892G10EK9VWx2nKYIVQ.text: Best BBQ  Brisket I had since Going to Brooklyn NYC and Texas A&M There Brisket melts in your mouth.  I will have to take Two Hole ones home thanks Walter's

eHUlWQd9pl9sBZIsEKRoGg.text: Nice place to eat, make sure you think about getting there with time to sit to wait for somewhere to sit. Fries are great. Hope you dont mind sitting with a dog. YES THEY ALLOW DOGS IN THE RESTAURANT WHERE YOU EAT.  Really off putting to me but to each their own.

AVL9ZzcOycNICxwZAqZp6A.text: The food was excellent but the service was terrible. Our poor waitress had to serve nearly thirty tables while other employees were just drinking beer. It took over 35 minutes for my friend to get his beer. If you are going for the food, this is great. The atmosphere was fun and playful with the yard games.

photos.caption: Photo of Walter's Southern Kitchen - Lawrenceville, PA, United States

vIJPDUtB5yo07DFB7wQLkA.text: SAVE YOURSELF THE TRIP! My friends and I were first time guests at Walter's BBQ in Lawrenceville on Saturday 4/13/19. Usually I am not one to complain but from the get go everything went downhill. *BEWARE* We got to Walter's a little after 6 about 6:30 pm . As we were told our wait time would be an hour. After we put in our names we decided to wait it out and get drinks at the bar, which was at least a 15 min wait until someone took care of us. As we went to the out door area we stood in the back of the patio area for 2 hours to get our notification about our table. I asked the hostess at one point how much longer when I was told " about an hour" I said we have already been waiting over the hour, the time we were told when we got there around 6:30. But we decided to keep waiting as we had already been there already for so long. She said " I cant help it people just don't get up from the tables". This is where the night just went horribly wrong. I got a call from the hostess at 8:13 pm to notify us about our table. I called them back literally 8:15pm ( I have photos for proof) as I have never got a call from this number before. We were not notified we would get a call or a text notification.I then went to the host that was obnoxiously rude to which I questioned " excuse me,  did you just call my name is Ashley . She replied "oh yes I called and you didn't pick up, so I gave away your table" .... I got 2 mins. Literally. That was it. Not even a 5 min wait for me to go up to the host and walk through the crowd of people.  So she said our table would be next. After we had already waited 2 hours. As we waited longer we were finally seated. Not once was there an apology for any of this. We got seated by the bar at a table to which we were screaming at each other to talk. Our waitress came and we ordered food. She was a younger blonde. We ordered more drinks and water as well as our meals. Our food came about 30 mins later but the sauce at the table was empty.  Our waitress NEVER once checked on us. The food was great but the service was SUPER poor. Finally as we were done eating I flagged down our waitress as she was standing folding silverware two tables behind us. She then told me to wait when I said "excuse me you're our waitress right?, we have a question." She finally came over as we told her, when we first ordered a long time ago we had asked for water as well as drinks about and hour ago and never got anything. She said "ok?" We didn't even get WATER. We paid our bill and no apology or reason for any of this was given. As first time guests we were very much disappointed by our very poor service. We bought multiple drinks while waiting and bought food and this is what we got in return?! I spoke to a man on my way out by the name of Oscar wearing a red shirt who said he was " kinda" the manager and told me sorry but you can email the manager from our website the email is on there. With no email to be found. Such a shame for such great food. Im sad to say we cant say anything good about our experience. We had high hopes. Save yourself the trouble

BdmsRuRxAoXw5Ku976uZ-A.text: Went for lunch, and it seems they really just cater to dinner crowd... Main dining room closed, no host, bartender has to be waiter... Brisket was excellent and so were the ribs. Happy they were not sauced. Sad they had no turkey or belly. Greens were good, but a bit too much vinegar. Cole slaw needs much more seasoning. All and all, really just nit-picking... I would recc you give them a try cause the BBQ is the main point: and that was excellent.

kxkUzYqsyRNbsQiHnJOr9w.text: Justin gave great service last night to our very large group and made our experience great! He was knowledgeable, friendly, efficient and organized. We really appreciated him taking such good care of us. We will be back!
